38 Preamble
39 --------
40 
41 This license establishes the terms under which a given free software Package
42 may be copied, modified, distributed, and/or redistributed. The intent is
43 that the Copyright Holder maintains some artistic control over the
44 development of that Package while still keeping the Package available as
45 open source and free software.
46 
47 You are always permitted to make arrangements wholly outside of this license
48 directly with the Copyright Holder of a given Package. If the terms of this
49 license do not permit the full use that you propose to make of the Package,
50 you should contact the Copyright Holder and seek a different licensing
51 arrangement.
52 
53 Definitions
54 -----------
55 
56 "Copyright Holder" means the individual(s) or organization(s) named in the
57 copyright notice for the entire Package.
58 
59 "Contributor" means any party that has contributed code or other material to
60 the Package, in accordance with the Copyright Holder's procedures.
61 
62 "You" and "your" means any person who would like to copy, distribute, or
63 modify the Package.
64 
65 "Package" means the collection of files distributed by the Copyright Holder,
66 and derivatives of that collection and/or of those files. A given Package may
67 consist of either the Standard Version, or a Modified Version.
68 
69 "Distribute" means providing a copy of the Package or making it accessible
70 to anyone else, or in the case of a company or organization, to others
71 outside of your company or organization.
72 
73 "Distributor Fee" means any fee that you charge for Distributing this
74 Package or providing support for this Package to another party. It does not
75 mean licensing fees.
76 
77 "Standard Version" refers to the Package if it has not been modified, or has
78 been modified only in ways explicitly requested by the Copyright Holder.
79 
80 "Modified Version" means the Package, if it has been changed, and such
81 changes were not explicitly requested by the Copyright Holder.
82 
83 "Original License" means this Artistic License as Distributed with the
84 Standard Version of the Package, in its current version or as it may be
85 modified by The Perl Foundation in the future.
86 
87 "Source" form means the source code, documentation source, and configuration
88 files for the Package.
89 
90 "Compiled" form means the compiled bytecode, object code, binary, or any
91 other form resulting from mechanical transformation or translation of the
92 Source form.
93 
94 Permission for Use and Modification Without Distribution
95 --------------------------------------------------------
96 
97 (1) You are permitted to use the Standard Version and create and use Modified
98  Versions for any purpose without restriction, provided that you do not
99  Distribute the Modified Version.
100 
101 Permissions for Redistribution of the Standard Version
102 ------------------------------------------------------
103 
104 (2) You may Distribute verbatim copies of the Source form of the Standard
105  Version of this Package in any medium without restriction, either gratis
106  or for a Distributor Fee, provided that you duplicate all of the original
107  copyright notices and associated disclaimers. At your discretion, such
108  verbatim copies may or may not include a Compiled form of the Package.
109 
110 (3) You may apply any bug fixes, portability changes, and other modifications
111  made available from the Copyright Holder. The resulting Package will still
112  be considered the Standard Version, and as such will be subject to the
113  Original License.
114 
115 Distribution of Modified Versions of the Package as Source
116 ----------------------------------------------------------
117 
118 (4) You may Distribute your Modified Version as Source (either gratis or for
119  a Distributor Fee, and with or without a Compiled form of the Modified
120  Version) provided that you clearly document how it differs from the
121  Standard Version, including, but not limited to, documenting any
122  non-standard features, executables, or modules, and provided that you do
123  at least ONE of the following:
124 
125  (a) make the Modified Version available to the Copyright Holder of the
126  Standard Version, under the Original License, so that the Copyright
127  Holder may include your modifications in the Standard Version.
128 
129  (b) ensure that installation of your Modified Version does not prevent the
130  user installing or running the Standard Version. In addition, the
131  Modified Version must bear a name that is different from the name of the
132  Standard Version.
133 
134  (c) allow anyone who receives a copy of the Modified Version to make the
135  Source form of the Modified Version available to others under
136 
137  (i) the Original License or
138 
139  (ii) a license that permits the licensee to freely copy, modify and
140  redistribute the Modified Version using the same licensing terms that
141  apply to the copy that the licensee received, and requires that the
142  Source form of the Modified Version, and of any works derived from it,
143  be made freely available in that license fees are prohibited but Distributor
144  Fees are allowed.
145 
146 Distribution of Compiled Forms of the Standard Version or Modified Versions
147 without the Source
148 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
149 
150 (5) You may Distribute Compiled forms of the Standard Version without the
151  Source, provided that you include complete instructions on how to get the
152  Source of the Standard Version. Such instructions must be valid at the
153  time of your distribution. If these instructions, at any time while you
154  are carrying out such distribution, become invalid, you must provide new
155  instructions on demand or cease further distribution. If you provide valid
156  instructions or cease distribution within thirty days after you become
157  aware that the instructions are invalid, then you do not forfeit any of
158  your rights under this license.
159 
160 (6) You may Distribute a Modified Version in Compiled form without the
161  Source, provided that you comply with Section 4 with respect to the Source
162  of the Modified Version.
163 
164 Aggregating or Linking the Package
165 ----------------------------------
166 
167 (7) You may aggregate the Package (either the Standard Version or Modified
168  Version) with other packages and Distribute the resulting aggregation
169  provided that you do not charge a licensing fee for the Package. Distributor
170  Fees are permitted, and licensing fees for other components in the
171  aggregation are permitted. The terms of this license apply to the use and
172  Distribution of the Standard or Modified Versions as included in the
173  aggregation.
174 
175 (8) You are permitted to link Modified and Standard Versions with other
176  works, to embed the Package in a larger work of your own, or to build
177  stand-alone binary or bytecode versions of applications that include the
178  Package, and Distribute the result without restriction, provided the
179  result does not expose a direct interface to the Package.
180 
181 Items That are Not Considered Part of a Modified Version
182 --------------------------------------------------------
183 
184 (9) Works (including, but not limited to, modules and scripts) that merely
185  extend or make use of the Package, do not, by themselves, cause the
186  Package to be a Modified Version. In addition, such works are not
187  considered parts of the Package itself, and are not subject to the
188  terms of this license. General Provisions
189 
190 (10) Any use, modification, and distribution of the Standard or Modified
191  Versions is governed by this Artistic License. By using, modifying or
192  distributing the Package, you accept this license. Do not use, modify,
193  or distribute the Package, if you do not accept this license.
194 
195 (11) If your Modified Version has been derived from a Modified Version made
196  by someone other than you, you are nevertheless required to ensure that
197  your Modified Version complies with the requirements of this license.
198 
199 (12) This license does not grant you the right to use any trademark, service
200  mark, tradename, or logo of the Copyright Holder.
201 
202 (13) This license includes the non-exclusive, worldwide, free-of-charge
203  patent license to make, have made, use, offer to sell, sell, import and
204  otherwise transfer the Package with respect to any patent claims
205  licensable by the Copyright Holder that are necessarily infringed by the
206  Package. If you institute patent litigation (including a cross-claim or
207  counterclaim) against any party alleging that the Package constitutes
208  direct or contributory patent infringement, then this Artistic License
209  to you shall terminate on the date that such litigation is filed.
210 
211 (14) Disclaimer of Warranty: THE PACKAGE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER
212  AND CONTRIBUTORS "AS IS' AND WITHOUT ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES.
213  THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
214  PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT ARE DISCLAIMED TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY

266 typedef int dbref;
267 typedef int FLAG;
268 typedef int POWER;
269 
270 typedef unsigned char Uchar;

272 typedef struct hookentry HOOKENT;
273 struct hookentry
274 {
275  dbref thing;
276  int atr;
277 };
278 
279 typedef struct key_linked_list KEYLIST;
280 struct key_linked_list
281 {
282  char *name;
283  int data;
284  struct key_linked_list *next;
285 };
286 
287 typedef struct str_linked_list LINKEDLIST;
288 struct str_linked_list
289 {
290  char *name;
291  char *value;
292  struct str_linked_list *next;
293 };
294 
295 typedef struct named_function NAMEDFUNC;
296 struct named_function
297 {
298  char *fn_name;
299  int (*handler)(dbref);
300 };
301 
302 typedef struct external_funcs EXTFUNCS;
303 struct external_funcs
304 {
305  int num_funcs;
306  NAMEDFUNC **ext_funcs;
307 };
308 
309 typedef struct global_register_data GDATA;
310 struct global_register_data
311 {
312  int q_alloc;
313  char **q_regs;
314  int *q_lens;
315  int xr_alloc;
316  char **x_names;
317  char **x_regs;
318  int *x_lens;
319  int dirty;
320 };
321 
322 typedef struct bque BQUE; /* Command queue */
323 struct bque
324 {
325  BQUE *next;
326  dbref player; /* player who will do command - halt is #-1 */
327  dbref cause; /* player causing command (for %N) */
328  int pid; /* internal process ID */
329  int waittime; /* time to run command */
330  dbref sem; /* blocking semaphore */
331  int attr; /* blocking attribute */
332  char *text; /* buffer for comm, env, and scr text */
333  char *comm; /* command */
334  char *env[NUM_ENV_VARS]; /* environment vars */
335  GDATA *gdata; /* temp vars */
336  int nargs; /* How many args I have */
337 };
338 
343 typedef enum CF_RESULT{ CF_Failure = -1, CF_Success, CF_Partial } CF_Result;
344 
345 #endif /* __TYPEDEFS_H */

354 
355 #define SYNC cache_sync()
356 #define CLOSE \
357  { \
358  cache_sync(); \
359  dddb_close(); \
360  }
361 #define DBCLOSE dddb_close()
362 #define OPTIMIZE (void)dddb_optimize()
363 
368 #define ATRNUM_BLOCK_SIZE (int)((mudstate.db_block_size - 32) / (2 * sizeof(int) + VNAME_SIZE))
369 #define ATRNUM_BLOCK_BYTES (int)((ATRNUM_BLOCK_SIZE) * (2 * sizeof(int) + VNAME_SIZE))
370 #define OBJECT_BLOCK_SIZE (int)((mudstate.db_block_size - 32) / (sizeof(int) + sizeof(DUMPOBJ)))
371 #define OBJECT_BLOCK_BYTES (int)((OBJECT_BLOCK_SIZE) * (sizeof(int) + sizeof(DUMPOBJ)))
372 #define ENTRY_NUM_BLOCKS(total, blksize) (int)(total / blksize)
373 #define ENTRY_BLOCK_STARTS(blk, blksize) (int)(blk * blksize)
374 #define ENTRY_BLOCK_ENDS(blk, blksize) (int)(blk * blksize) + (blksize - 1)
375 
376 #define ITER_PARENTS(t, p, l) for ((l) = 0, (p) = (t); \
377  (Good_obj(p) && \
378  ((l) < mudconf.parent_nest_lim)); \
379  (p) = Parent(p), (l)++)
380 
381 #define Hasprivs(x) (Royalty(x) || Wizard(x))
382 
383 typedef char boolexp_type;
384 
385 typedef struct attr ATTR;
386 struct attr
387 {
388  const char *name;
389  int number;
390  int flags;
391  int (*check)(int, dbref, dbref, int, char *);
392 };
393 
394 extern ATTR attr[];
395 
396 extern ATTR **anum_table;
397 
398 #define anum_get(x) (anum_table[(x)])
399 #define anum_set(x, v) anum_table[(x)] = v
400 
405 #define ATR_INFO_CHAR '\1'
406 
411 #define BOOLEXP_AND 0
412 #define BOOLEXP_OR 1
413 #define BOOLEXP_NOT 2
414 #define BOOLEXP_CONST 3
415 #define BOOLEXP_ATR 4
416 #define BOOLEXP_INDIR 5
417 #define BOOLEXP_CARRY 6
418 #define BOOLEXP_IS 7
419 #define BOOLEXP_OWNER 8
420 #define BOOLEXP_EVAL 9
421 
422 typedef struct boolexp BOOLEXP;
423 struct boolexp
424 {
425  boolexp_type type;
426  BOOLEXP *sub1;
427  BOOLEXP *sub2;
428  dbref thing;
429 };
430 
431 #define TRUE_BOOLEXP ((BOOLEXP *)NULL)
432 
437 #define F_UNKNOWN 0
438 #define F_MUSH 1
439 #define F_MUSE 2
440 #define F_MUD 3
441 #define F_MUCK 4
442 #define F_MUX 5
443 #define F_TINYMUSH 6
445 #define V_MASK 0x000000ff
446 #define V_ZONE 0x00000100
447 #define V_LINK 0x00000200
448 #define V_GDBM 0x00000400
449 #define V_ATRNAME 0x00000800
450 #define V_ATRKEY 0x00001000
451 #define V_PERNKEY 0x00001000
452 #define V_PARENT 0x00002000
453 #define V_COMM 0x00004000
454 #define V_ATRMONEY 0x00008000
455 #define V_XFLAGS 0x00010000
456 #define V_POWERS 0x00020000
457 #define V_3FLAGS 0x00040000
458 #define V_QUOTED 0x00080000
459 #define V_TQUOTAS 0x00100000
460 #define V_TIMESTAMPS 0x00200000
461 #define V_VISUALATTRS 0x00400000
462 #define V_CREATETIME 0x00800000
463 #define V_DBCLEAN 0x80000000
465 /* special dbref's */
466 #define NOTHING (-1)
467 #define AMBIGUOUS (-2)
468 #define HOME (-3)
469 #define NOPERM (-4)
471 typedef struct object OBJ;
472 struct object
473 {
474  dbref location;
477  dbref contents;
479  dbref exits;
481  dbref next;
484  dbref link;
486  dbref parent;
487  dbref owner;
489  dbref zone;
490  FLAG flags;
491  FLAG flags2;
492  FLAG flags3;
493  POWER powers;
494  POWER powers2;
495  time_t create_time;
496  time_t last_access;
497  time_t last_mod;
503  int name_length;
504  int stack_count;
505  int vars_count;
506  int struct_count;
507  int instance_count;
508  struct timeval cpu_time_used;
509 #ifdef MEMORY_BASED
510  Obj attrtext;
511 #endif
512 };
513 
519 typedef struct dump_object DUMPOBJ;
520 struct dump_object
521 {
522  dbref location;
525  dbref contents;
527  dbref exits;
529  dbref next;
532  dbref link;
534  dbref parent;
535  dbref owner;
537  dbref zone;
538  FLAG flags;
539  FLAG flags2;
540  FLAG flags3;
541  POWER powers;
542  POWER powers2;
543  time_t create_time;
544  time_t last_access;
545  time_t last_mod;
546 };
547 
548 typedef char *NAME;
549 extern OBJ *db;
550 extern NAME *names;
551 extern NAME *purenames;
552 extern int anum_alc_top;
554 #define Location(t) db[t].location
555 
556 #define Zone(t) db[t].zone
557 
558 #define Contents(t) db[t].contents
559 #define Exits(t) db[t].exits
560 #define Next(t) db[t].next
561 #define Link(t) db[t].link
562 #define Owner(t) db[t].owner
563 #define Parent(t) db[t].parent
564 #define Flags(t) db[t].flags
565 #define Flags2(t) db[t].flags2
566 #define Flags3(t) db[t].flags3
567 #define Powers(t) db[t].powers
568 #define Powers2(t) db[t].powers2
569 #define NameLen(t) db[t].name_length
570 #define Home(t) Link(t)
571 #define Dropto(t) Location(t)
572 
573 #define AccessTime(t) db[t].last_access
574 #define ModTime(t) db[t].last_mod
575 #define CreateTime(t) db[t].create_time
576 
577 #define VarsCount(t) db[t].vars_count
578 #define StackCount(t) db[t].stack_count
579 #define StructCount(t) db[t].struct_count
580 #define InstanceCount(t) db[t].instance_count
581 
582 #define Time_Used(t) db[t].cpu_time_used
583 #define s_Time_Used(t, n) \
584  db[t].cpu_time_used.tv_sec = n.tv_sec; \
585  db[t].cpu_time_used.tv_usec = n.tv_usec
586 
593 #define s_Location(t, n) \
594  db[t].location = (n); \
595  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
596 #define s_Zone(t, n) \
597  db[t].zone = (n); \
598  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
599 #define s_Contents(t, n) \
600  db[t].contents = (n); \
601  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
602 #define s_Exits(t, n) \
603  db[t].exits = (n); \
604  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
605 #define s_Next(t, n) \
606  db[t].next = (n); \
607  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
608 #define s_Link(t, n) \
609  db[t].link = (n); \
610  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
611 #define s_Owner(t, n) \
612  db[t].owner = (n); \
613  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
614 #define s_Parent(t, n) \
615  db[t].parent = (n); \
616  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
617 #define s_Flags(t, n) \
618  db[t].flags = (n); \
619  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
620 #define s_Flags2(t, n) \
621  db[t].flags2 = (n); \
622  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
623 #define s_Flags3(t, n) \
624  db[t].flags3 = (n); \
625  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
626 #define s_Powers(t, n) \
627  db[t].powers = (n); \
628  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
629 #define s_Powers2(t, n) \
630  db[t].powers2 = (n); \
631  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
632 #define s_AccessTime(t, n) \
633  db[t].last_access = (n); \
634  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
635 #define s_ModTime(t, n) \
636  db[t].last_mod = (n); \
637  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
638 #define s_CreateTime(t, n) \
639  db[t].create_time = (n); \
640  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
641 #define s_Accessed(t) \
642  db[t].last_access = mudstate.now; \
643  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
644 #define s_Modified(t) \
645  db[t].last_mod = mudstate.now; \
646  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
647 #define s_Created(t) \
648  db[t].create_time = mudstate.now; \
649  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
650 #define s_Clean(t) db[t].flags3 = db[t].flags3 & ~DIRTY
651 #define s_NameLen(t, n) db[t].name_length = (n)
652 #define s_Home(t, n) s_Link(t, n)
653 #define s_Dropto(t, n) s_Location(t, n)
654 #define s_VarsCount(t, n) db[t].vars_count = n;
655 #define s_StackCount(t, n) db[t].stack_count = n;
656 #define s_StructCount(t, n) db[t].struct_count = n;
657 #define s_InstanceCount(t, n) db[t].instance_count = n;
658 
659 #define tf_pclose(f) tf_fclose(f)
660 
661 #define putref(pr__f, pr__ref) fprintf(pr__f, "%d\n", (int)pr__ref)
662 #define putlong(pr__f, pr__i) fprintf(pr__f, "%ld\n", (long)pr__i)
663 
664 #define DOLIST(thing, list) \
665  for ((thing) = (list); \
666  ((thing) != NOTHING) && (Next(thing) != (thing)); \
667  (thing) = Next(thing))
668 #define SAFE_DOLIST(thing, next, list) \
669  for ((thing) = (list), (next) = ((thing) == NOTHING ? NOTHING : Next(thing)); \
670  (thing) != NOTHING && (Next(thing) != (thing)); \
671  (thing) = (next), (next) = Next(next))
672 #define DO_WHOLE_DB(thing) \
673  for ((thing) = 0; (thing) < mudstate.db_top; (thing)++)
674 #define DO_WHOLE_DB_BACKWARDS(thing) \
675  for ((thing) = mudstate.db_top - 1; (thing) >= 0; (thing)--)
676 
677 #define Dropper(thing) (Connected(Owner(thing)) && Hearer(thing))
678 
683 #define Clear_Player_Aliases(x, b) \
684  { \
685  char *cpa__p, *cpa__tokp; \
686  for (cpa__p = strtok_r((b), ";", &cpa__tokp); cpa__p; \
687  cpa__p = strtok_r(NULL, ";", &cpa__tokp)) \
688  { \
689  delete_player_name((x), cpa__p); \
690  } \
691  }
692 
693 typedef struct logfiletable LOGFILETAB;
694 struct logfiletable
695 {
696  int log_flag;
697  FILE *fileptr;
698  char *filename;
699 };
700 
701 typedef struct numbertable NUMBERTAB;
702 struct numbertable
703 {
704  int num;
705 };

713 
714 #ifndef __GAME_H
715 #define __GAME_H
716 
717 /* Do not change anything unless you are certain you know what it does.
718  * General user-definable compile-time options can be found in the
719  * configure script.
720  */
721 
722 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
723  * Database R/W flags.
724  */
725 
726 #define MANDFLAGS (V_LINK | V_PARENT | V_XFLAGS | V_ZONE | V_POWERS | V_3FLAGS | V_QUOTED | V_TQUOTAS | V_TIMESTAMPS | V_VISUALATTRS | V_CREATETIME)
727 
728 #define OFLAGS1 (V_GDBM | V_ATRKEY) /* GDBM has these */
729 
730 #define OFLAGS2 (V_ATRNAME | V_ATRMONEY)
731 
732 #define OUTPUT_VERSION 1 /* Version 1 */
733 #define OUTPUT_FLAGS (MANDFLAGS | OFLAGS1 | OFLAGS2)
734 /* format for dumps */
735 
736 #define UNLOAD_VERSION 1 /* version for export */
737 #define UNLOAD_OUTFLAGS (MANDFLAGS) /* format for export */
738 
739 /* magic lock cookies */
740 #define NOT_TOKEN '!'
741 #define AND_TOKEN '&'
742 #define OR_TOKEN '|'
743 #define LOOKUP_TOKEN '*'
744 #define NUMBER_TOKEN '#'
745 #define INDIR_TOKEN '@' /* One of these two should go. */
746 #define CARRY_TOKEN '+' /* One of these two should go. */
747 #define IS_TOKEN '='
748 #define OWNER_TOKEN '$'
749 
750 /* matching attribute tokens */
751 #define AMATCH_CMD '$'
752 #define AMATCH_LISTEN '^'
753 
754 /* delimiters for various things */
755 #define EXIT_DELIMITER ';'
756 #define ARG_DELIMITER '='
757 
758 /* These chars get replaced by the current item from a list in commands and
759  * functions that do iterative replacement, such as @apply_marked, dolist,
760  * the eval= operator for @search, and iter().
761  */
762 
763 #define BOUND_VAR "##"
764 #define LISTPLACE_VAR "#@"
765 
766 /* This token is similar, marking the first argument in a switch. */
767 
768 #define SWITCH_VAR "#$"
769 
770 /* This token is used to denote a null output delimiter. */
771 
772 #define NULL_DELIM_VAR "@@"
773 
774 /* This is used to indent output from pretty-printing. */
775 
776 #define INDENT_STR " "
777 
778 /* This is used as the 'null' delimiter for structures stored via write(). */
779 
780 #define GENERIC_STRUCT_DELIM '\f' /* form feed char */
781 #define GENERIC_STRUCT_STRDELIM "\f"
782 
783 /* amount of object endowment, based on cost */
784 #define OBJECT_ENDOWMENT(cost) (((cost) / mudconf.sacfactor) + mudconf.sacadjust)
785 
786 /* !!! added for recycling, return value of object */
787 #define OBJECT_DEPOSIT(pennies) \
788  (((pennies)-mudconf.sacadjust) * mudconf.sacfactor)
789 
790 //#define StringCopy strcpy
791 //#define StringCopyTrunc strncpy
792 
793 #define DEV_NULL "/dev/null"
794 
795 /* This is used to define the version of our backup file */
796 #define BACKUP_VERSION 1
797 
798 #define PCRE_MAX_OFFSETS 99
799 
800 #endif /* __GAME_H */
801 
802 
803 /*
804  * From alloc.h
805  */
806 
807 #ifndef __ALLOC_H
808 #define __ALLOC_H
809 
810 #define XMAGIC 0x00deadbeefbaad00
811 
812 // Allocation Functions
813 #define XMALLOC(s, v) __xmalloc(s, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, v)
814 #define XNMALLOC(s) __xmalloc(s, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL)
815 #define XCALLOC(n, s, v) __xcalloc(n, s, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, v)
816 #define XNCALLOC(n, s) __xcalloc(n, s, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL)
817 #define XREALLOC(p, s, v) __xrealloc(p, s, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, v)
818 #define XNREALLOC(p, s) __xrealloc(p, s, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL)
819 #define XFREE(p) __xfree(p)
820 #define XHEADER(p) (MEMTRACK *)((char *)p - sizeof(MEMTRACK));
821 
822 // String Functions
823 #define XASPRINTF(v, f, ...) __xasprintf(__FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, v, f, ##__VA_ARGS__)
824 #define XNASPRINTF(f, ...) __xasprintf(NULL, 0, NULL, NULL, f, ##__VA_ARGS__);
825 #define XSPRINTF(s, f, ...) __xsprintf(s, f, ##__VA_ARGS__)
826 #define XSPRINTFCAT(s, f, ...) __xsprintfcat(s, f, ##__VA_ARGS__)
827 #define XVSPRINTF(s, f, a) __xvsprintf(s, f, a)
828 #define XSNPRINTF(s, n, f, ...) __xsnprintf(s, n, f, ##__VA_ARGS__)
829 #define XVSNPRINTF(s, n, f, a) __xvsnprintf(s, n, f, a)
830 #define XSTRDUP(s, v) __xstrdup(s, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, v)
831 #define XNSTRDUP(s) __xstrdup(s, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL)
832 #define XSTRCAT(d, s) __xstrcat(d, s)
833 #define XSTRNCAT(d, s, n) __xstrncat(d, s, n)
834 #define XSTRCCAT(d, s) __xstrccat(d, s)
835 #define XSTRNCCAT(d, s, n) __xstrnccat(d, s, n)
836 #define XSTRCPY(d, s) __xstrcpy(d, s)
837 #define XSTRNCPY(d, s, n) __xstrncpy(d, s, n)
838 #define XMEMMOVE(d, s, n) __xmemmove(d, s, n)
839 #define XMEMCPY(d, s, n) __xmemmove(d, s, n)
840 #define XMEMSET(s, c, n) __xmemset(s, c, n)
841 
842 // Replacement for the safe_* functions.
843 #define SAFE_SPRINTF(s, p, f, ...) __xsafesprintf(s, p, f, ##__VA_ARGS__);
844 
845 #define SAFE_COPY_CHR(c, b, p, s) __xsafestrcatchr(b, p, c, s)
846 #define SAFE_STRCATCHR(b, p, c, s) __xsafestrcatchr(b, p, c, s)
847 
848 #define SAFE_LB_CHR(c, b, p) __xsafestrcatchr(b, p, c, LBUF_SIZE - 1)
849 #define SAFE_SB_CHR(c, b, p) __xsafestrcatchr(b, p, c, SBUF_SIZE - 1)
850 #define SAFE_MB_CHR(c, b, p) __xsafestrcatchr(b, p, c, MBUF_SIZE - 1)
851 
852 #define SAFE_STRNCAT(b, p, s, n, z) __xsafestrncat(b, p, s, n, z);
853 #define SAFE_STRCAT(b, p, s, n) (s ? __xsafestrncat(b, p, s, strlen(s), n) : 0)
854 
855 #define SAFE_LB_STR(s, b, p) (s ? __xsafestrncpy(b, p, s, strlen(s), LBUF_SIZE - 1) : 0)
856 #define SAFE_SB_STR(s, b, p) (s ? __xsafestrncpy(b, p, s, strlen(s), SBUF_SIZE - 1) : 0)
857 #define SAFE_MB_STR(s, b, p) (s ? __xsafestrncpy(b, p, s, strlen(s), MBUF_SIZE - 1) : 0)
858 
859 #define SAFE_CRLF(b, p) SAFE_STRCAT(b, p, "\r\n", LBUF_SIZE - 1)
860 #define SAFE_ANSI_NORMAL(b, p) SAFE_STRCAT(b, p, ANSI_NORMAL, LBUF_SIZE - 1)
861 #define SAFE_NOTHING(b, p) SAFE_STRCAT(b, p, "#-1", LBUF_SIZE - 1)
862 #define SAFE_NOPERM(b, p) SAFE_STRCAT(b, p, "#-1 PERMISSION DENIED", LBUF_SIZE - 1)
863 #define SAFE_NOMATCH(b, p) SAFE_STRCAT(b, p, "#-1 NO MATCH", LBUF_SIZE - 1)
864 #define SAFE_BOOL(b, p, n) SAFE_LB_CHR(((n) ? '1' : '0'), (b), (p))
865 
866 #define SAFE_LTOS(d, p, n, s) __xsafeltos(d, p, n, s)
867 
868 // Misc Macros
869 #define XGETSIZE(p) (((char *)__xfind(p)->magic - p) - sizeof(char))
870 #define XCALSIZE(s, d, p) ((s - ((*p) - d)))
871 #define XLTOS(n) __xasprintf(__FILE__, __LINE__, __func__, "XLTOS", "%ld", n)
872 
873 typedef struct tracemem_header
874 {
875  size_t size;
876  void *bptr;
877  const char *file;
878  int line;
879  const char *function;
880  const char *var;
881  uint64_t *magic;
882  struct tracemem_header *next;
883 } MEMTRACK;
884 
885 #define HBUF_SIZE 32768
886 #define LBUF_SIZE 8192
887 #define GBUF_SIZE 1024
888 #define MBUF_SIZE 512
889 #define SBUF_SIZE 64
891 #endif /* __ALLOC_H */
892 
893 
894 /*
895  * From flags.h
896  */
897 
898 #ifndef __FLAGS_H
899 #define __FLAGS_H
900 
901 #define FLAG_WORD1 0x0 /* 1st word of flags. */
902 #define FLAG_WORD2 0x1 /* 2nd word of flags. */
903 #define FLAG_WORD3 0x2 /* 3rd word of flags. */
904 
905 /* Object types */
906 #define TYPE_ROOM 0x0
907 #define TYPE_THING 0x1
908 #define TYPE_EXIT 0x2
909 #define TYPE_PLAYER 0x3
910 #define TYPE_ZONE 0x4
911 #define TYPE_GARBAGE 0x5
912 #define GOODTYPE 0x5 /* Values less than this pass Good_obj check */
913 #define NOTYPE 0x7
914 #define TYPE_MASK 0x7
915 
916 /* First word of flags */
917 #define SEETHRU 0x00000008 /* Can see through to the other side */
918 #define WIZARD 0x00000010 /* gets automatic control */
919 #define LINK_OK 0x00000020 /* anybody can link to this room */
920 #define DARK 0x00000040 /* Don't show contents or presence */
921 #define JUMP_OK 0x00000080 /* Others may @tel here */
922 #define STICKY 0x00000100 /* Object goes home when dropped */
923 #define DESTROY_OK 0x00000200 /* Others may @destroy */
924 #define HAVEN 0x00000400 /* No killing here, or no pages */
925 #define QUIET 0x00000800 /* Prevent 'feelgood' messages */
926 #define HALT 0x00001000 /* object cannot perform actions */
927 #define TRACE 0x00002000 /* Generate evaluation trace output */
928 #define GOING 0x00004000 /* object is available for recycling */
929 #define MONITOR 0x00008000 /* Process ^x:action listens on obj? */
930 #define MYOPIC 0x00010000 /* See things as nonowner/nonwizard */
931 #define PUPPET 0x00020000 /* Relays ALL messages to owner */
932 #define CHOWN_OK 0x00040000 /* Object may be @chowned freely */
933 #define ENTER_OK 0x00080000 /* Object may be ENTERed */
934 #define VISUAL 0x00100000 /* Everyone can see properties */
935 #define IMMORTAL 0x00200000 /* Object can't be killed */
936 #define HAS_STARTUP 0x00400000 /* Load some attrs at startup */
937 #define OPAQUE 0x00800000 /* Can't see inside */
938 #define VERBOSE 0x01000000 /* Tells owner everything it does. */
939 #define INHERIT 0x02000000 /* Gets owner's privs. (i.e. Wiz) */
940 #define NOSPOOF 0x04000000 /* Report originator of all actions. */
941 #define ROBOT 0x08000000 /* Player is a ROBOT */
942 #define SAFE 0x10000000 /* Need /override to @destroy */
943 #define ROYALTY 0x20000000 /* Sees like a wiz, but ca't modify */
944 #define HEARTHRU 0x40000000 /* Can hear out of this obj or exit */
945 #define TERSE 0x80000000 /* Only show room name on look */
946 
947 /* Second word of flags */
948 #define KEY 0x00000001 /* No puppets */
949 #define ABODE 0x00000002 /* May @set home here */
950 #define FLOATING 0x00000004 /* -- Legacy -- */
951 #define UNFINDABLE 0x00000008 /* Can't loc() from afar */
952 #define PARENT_OK 0x00000010 /* Others may @parent to me */
953 #define LIGHT 0x00000020 /* Visible in dark places */
954 #define HAS_LISTEN 0x00000040 /* Internal: LISTEN attr set */
955 #define HAS_FWDLIST 0x00000080 /* Internal: FORWARDLIST attr set */
956 #define AUDITORIUM 0x00000100 /* Should we check the SpeechLock? */
957 #define ANSI 0x00000200
958 #define HEAD_FLAG 0x00000400
959 #define FIXED 0x00000800
960 #define UNINSPECTED 0x00001000
961 #define ZONE_PARENT 0x00002000 /* Check as local master room */
962 #define DYNAMIC 0x00004000
963 #define NOBLEED 0x00008000
964 #define STAFF 0x00010000
965 #define HAS_DAILY 0x00020000
966 #define GAGGED 0x00040000
967 #define HAS_COMMANDS 0x00080000 /* Check it for $commands */
968 #define STOP_MATCH 0x00100000 /* Stop matching commands if found */
969 #define BOUNCE 0x00200000 /* Forward messages to contents */
970 #define CONTROL_OK 0x00400000 /* ControlLk specifies who ctrls me */
971 #define CONSTANT_ATTRS 0x00800000 /* Can't set attrs on this object */
972 #define VACATION 0x01000000
973 #define PLAYER_MAILS 0x02000000 /* Mail message in progress */
974 #define HTML 0x04000000 /* Player supports HTML */
975 #define BLIND 0x08000000 /* Suppress has arrived / left msgs */
976 #define SUSPECT 0x10000000 /* Report some activities to wizards */
977 #define WATCHER 0x20000000 /* Watch logins */
978 #define CONNECTED 0x40000000 /* Player is connected */
979 #define SLAVE 0x80000000 /* Disallow most commands */
980 
981 /* Third word of flags */
982 #define REDIR_OK 0x00000001 /* Can be victim of @redirect */
983 #define HAS_REDIRECT 0x00000002 /* Victim of @redirect */
984 #define ORPHAN 0x00000004 /* Don't check parent chain for $cmd */
985 #define HAS_DARKLOCK 0x00000008 /* Has a DarkLock */
986 #define DIRTY 0x00000010 /* Temporary flag: object is dirty */
987 #define NODEFAULT 0x00000020 /* Not subject to attr defaults */
988 #define PRESENCE 0x00000040 /* Check presence-related locks */
989 #define HAS_SPEECHMOD 0x00000080 /* Check @speechmod attr */
990 #define HAS_PROPDIR 0X00000100 /* Internal: has Propdir attr */
991 #define COLOR256 0x00000200 /* Player support XTERM 256 colors */
992 #define FLAG_RES02 0x00000400
993 #define FLAG_RES03 0x00000800
994 #define FLAG_RES04 0x00001000
995 #define FLAG_RES05 0x00002000
996 #define FLAG_RES06 0x00004000
997 #define FLAG_RES07 0x00008000
998 #define FLAG_RES08 0x00010000
999 #define FLAG_RES09 0x00020000
1000 #define FLAG_RES10 0x00040000
1001 #define FLAG_RES11 0x00080000
1002 #define FLAG_RES12 0x00100000
1003 #define FLAG_RES13 0x00200000
1004 /* FREE FREE FREE */
1005 #define MARK_0 0x00400000 /* User-defined flags */
1006 #define MARK_1 0x00800000
1007 #define MARK_2 0x01000000
1008 #define MARK_3 0x02000000
1009 #define MARK_4 0x04000000
1010 #define MARK_5 0x08000000
1011 #define MARK_6 0x10000000
1012 #define MARK_7 0x20000000
1013 #define MARK_8 0x40000000
1014 #define MARK_9 0x80000000
1015 #define MARK_FLAGS 0xffc00000 /* Bitwise-or of all marker flags */
1016 
1017 /*
1018  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1019  * FLAGENT: Information about object flags.
1020  */
1021 
1022 typedef struct flag_entry
1023 {
1024  const char *flagname; /* Name of the flag */
1025  int flagvalue; /* Which bit in the object is the
1026  * flag */
1027  char flaglett; /* Flag letter for listing */
1028  int flagflag; /* Ctrl flags for this flag
1029  * (recursive? :-) */
1030  int listperm; /* Who sees this flag when set */
1031  int (*handler)(); /* Handler for setting/clearing this flag */
1032 } FLAGENT;
1033 
1034 /*
1035  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1036  * OBJENT: Fundamental object types
1037  */
1038 
1039 typedef struct object_entry
1040 {
1041  const char *name;
1042  char lett;
1043  int perm;
1044  int flags;
1045 } OBJENT;
1046 extern OBJENT object_types[8];
1047 
1048 #define OF_CONTENTS 0x0001 /* Object has contents: Contents() */
1049 #define OF_LOCATION 0x0002 /* Object has a location: Location() */
1050 #define OF_EXITS 0x0004 /* Object has exits: Exits() */
1051 #define OF_HOME 0x0008 /* Object has a home: Home() */
1052 #define OF_DROPTO 0x0010 /* Object has a dropto: Dropto() */
1053 #define OF_OWNER 0x0020 /* Object can own other objects */
1054 #define OF_SIBLINGS 0x0040 /* Object has siblings: Next() */
1055 
1056 typedef struct flagset
1057 {
1058  FLAG word1;
1059  FLAG word2;
1060  FLAG word3;
1061 } FLAGSET;
1062 
1063 #define GOD ((dbref)1)
1064 
1065 /* ---------------------- Object Permission/Attribute Macros */
1066 /* IS(X,T,F) - Is X of type T and have flag F set? */
1067 /* Typeof(X) - What object type is X */
1068 /* God(X) - Is X player #1 */
1069 /* Robot(X) - Is X a robot player */
1070 /* Wizard(X) - Does X have wizard privs */
1071 /* Immortal(X) - Is X unkillable */
1072 /* Alive(X) - Is X a player or a puppet */
1073 /* Dark(X) - Is X dark */
1074 /* Quiet(X) - Should 'Set.' messages et al from X be disabled */
1075 /* Verbose(X) - Should owner receive all commands executed? */
1076 /* Trace(X) - Should owner receive eval trace output? */
1077 /* Player_haven(X) - Is the owner of X no-page */
1078 /* Haven(X) - Is X no-kill(rooms) or no-page(players) */
1079 /* Halted(X) - Is X halted (not allowed to run commands)? */
1080 /* Suspect(X) - Is X someone the wizzes should keep an eye on */
1081 /* Slave(X) - Should X be prevented from db-changing commands */
1082 /* Safe(X,P) - Does P need the /OVERRIDE switch to @destroy X? */
1083 /* Monitor(X) - Should we check for ^xxx:xxx listens on player? */
1084 /* Terse(X) - Should we only show the room name on a look? */
1085 /* Myopic(X) - Should things as if we were nonowner/nonwiz */
1086 /* Audible(X) - Should X forward messages? */
1087 /* Findroom(X) - Can players in room X be found via @whereis? */
1088 /* Unfindroom(X) - Is @whereis blocked for players in room X? */
1089 /* Findable(X) - Can @whereis find X */
1090 /* Unfindable(X) - Is @whereis blocked for X */
1091 /* No_robots(X) - Does X disallow robot players from using */
1092 /* Has_location(X) - Is X something with a location (ie plyr or obj) */
1093 /* Has_home(X) - Is X something with a home (ie plyr or obj) */
1094 /* Has_contents(X) - Is X something with contents (ie plyr/obj/room) */
1095 /* Good_dbref(X) - Is X inside the DB? */
1096 /* Good_obj(X) - Is X inside the DB and have a valid type? */
1097 /* Good_owner(X) - Is X a good owner value? */
1098 /* Good_home(X) - Is X a good home value? */
1099 /* Good_loc(X) - Is X a good location value? */
1100 /* Going(X) - Is X marked GOING? */
1101 /* Inherits(X) - Does X inherit the privs of its owner */
1102 /* Examinable(P,X) - Can P look at attribs of X */
1103 /* MyopicExam(P,X) - Can P look at attribs of X (obeys MYOPIC) */
1104 /* Controls(P,X) - Can P force X to do something */
1105 /* Darkened(P,X) - Is X dark, and does P pass its DarkLock? */
1106 /* Can_See(P,X,L) - Can P see thing X, depending on location dark (L)? */
1107 /* Can_See_Exit(P,X,L) - Can P see exit X, depending on loc dark (L)? */
1108 /* Abode(X) - Is X an ABODE room */
1109 /* Link_exit(P,X) - Can P link from exit X */
1110 /* Linkable(P,X) - Can P link to X */
1111 /* Mark(x) - Set marked flag on X */
1112 /* Unmark(x) - Clear marked flag on X */
1113 /* Marked(x) - Check marked flag on X */
1114 /* See_attr(P,X,A,O,F) - Can P see text attr A on X if attr has owner O */
1115 /* Set_attr(P,X,A,F) - Can P set/change text attr A (with flags F) on X */
1116 /* Read_attr(P,X,A,O,F) - Can P see attr A on X if attr has owner O */
1117 /* Write_attr(P,X,A,F) - Can P set/change attr A (with flags F) on X */
1118 /* Lock_attr(P,X,A,O) - Can P lock/unlock attr A (with owner O) on X */
1119 
1120 #define IS(thing, type, flag) ((Typeof(thing) == (type)) && (Flags(thing) & (flag)))
1121 #define Typeof(x) (Flags(x) & TYPE_MASK)
1122 #define God(x) ((x) == GOD)
1123 #define Robot(x) (isPlayer(x) && ((Flags(x) & ROBOT) != 0))
1124 #define Alive(x) (isPlayer(x) || (Puppet(x) && Has_contents(x)))
1125 #define OwnsOthers(x) ((object_types[Typeof(x)].flags & OF_OWNER) != 0)
1126 #define Has_location(x) ((object_types[Typeof(x)].flags & OF_LOCATION) != 0)
1127 #define Has_contents(x) ((object_types[Typeof(x)].flags & OF_CONTENTS) != 0)
1128 #define Has_exits(x) ((object_types[Typeof(x)].flags & OF_EXITS) != 0)
1129 #define Has_siblings(x) ((object_types[Typeof(x)].flags & OF_SIBLINGS) != 0)
1130 #define Has_home(x) ((object_types[Typeof(x)].flags & OF_HOME) != 0)
1131 #define Has_dropto(x) ((object_types[Typeof(x)].flags & OF_DROPTO) != 0)
1132 #define Home_ok(x) ((object_types[Typeof(x)].flags & OF_HOME) != 0)
1133 #define isPlayer(x) (Typeof(x) == TYPE_PLAYER)
1134 #define isRoom(x) (Typeof(x) == TYPE_ROOM)
1135 #define isExit(x) (Typeof(x) == TYPE_EXIT)
1136 #define isThing(x) (Typeof(x) == TYPE_THING)
1137 #define isGarbage(x) (Typeof(x) == TYPE_GARBAGE)
1138 
1139 #define Good_dbref(x) (((x) >= 0) && ((x) < mudstate.db_top))
1140 #define Good_obj(x) (Good_dbref(x) && (Typeof(x) < GOODTYPE))
1141 #define Good_owner(x) (Good_obj(x) && OwnsOthers(x))
1142 #define Good_home(x) (Good_obj(x) && Home_ok(x))
1143 #define Good_loc(x) (Good_obj(x) && Has_contents(x))
1144 
1145 #define Royalty(x) ((Flags(x) & ROYALTY) != 0)
1146 #define WizRoy(x) (Royalty(x) || Wizard(x))
1147 #define Staff(x) ((Flags2(x) & STAFF) != 0)
1148 #define Head(x) ((Flags2(x) & HEAD_FLAG) != 0)
1149 #define Fixed(x) ((Flags2(x) & FIXED) != 0)
1150 #define Uninspected(x) ((Flags2(x) & UNINSPECTED) != 0)
1151 #define Ansi(x) ((Flags2(x) & ANSI) != 0)
1152 #define Color256(x) ((Flags3(x) & COLOR256) != 0)
1153 #define NoBleed(x) ((Flags2(x) & NOBLEED) != 0)
1154 
1155 #define Transparent(x) ((Flags(x) & SEETHRU) != 0)
1156 #define Link_ok(x) (((Flags(x) & LINK_OK) != 0) && Has_contents(x))
1157 #define Wizard(x) ((Flags(x) & WIZARD) || \
1158  ((Flags(Owner(x)) & WIZARD) && Inherits(x)))
1159 #define Dark(x) (((Flags(x) & DARK) != 0) && \
1160  (!Alive(x) || \
1161  (Wizard(x) && !mudconf.visible_wizzes) || \
1162  Can_Cloak(x)))
1163 #define DarkMover(x) ((Wizard(x) || Can_Cloak(x)) && Dark(x))
1164 #define Jump_ok(x) (((Flags(x) & JUMP_OK) != 0) && Has_contents(x))
1165 #define Sticky(x) ((Flags(x) & STICKY) != 0)
1166 #define Destroy_ok(x) ((Flags(x) & DESTROY_OK) != 0)
1167 #define Haven(x) ((Flags(x) & HAVEN) != 0)
1168 #define Player_haven(x) ((Flags(Owner(x)) & HAVEN) != 0)
1169 #define Quiet(x) ((Flags(x) & QUIET) != 0)
1170 #define Halted(x) ((Flags(x) & HALT) != 0)
1171 #define Trace(x) ((Flags(x) & TRACE) != 0)
1172 #define Going(x) ((Flags(x) & GOING) != 0)
1173 #define Monitor(x) ((Flags(x) & MONITOR) != 0)
1174 #define Myopic(x) ((Flags(x) & MYOPIC) != 0)
1175 #define Puppet(x) ((Flags(x) & PUPPET) != 0)
1176 #define Chown_ok(x) ((Flags(x) & CHOWN_OK) != 0)
1177 #define Enter_ok(x) (((Flags(x) & ENTER_OK) != 0) && \
1178  Has_location(x) && Has_contents(x))
1179 #define Visual(x) ((Flags(x) & VISUAL) != 0)
1180 #define Immortal(x) ((Flags(x) & IMMORTAL) || \
1181  ((Flags(Owner(x)) & IMMORTAL) && Inherits(x)))
1182 #define Opaque(x) ((Flags(x) & OPAQUE) != 0)
1183 #define Verbose(x) ((Flags(x) & VERBOSE) != 0)
1184 #define Inherits(x) (((Flags(x) & INHERIT) != 0) || \
1185  ((Flags(Owner(x)) & INHERIT) != 0) || \
1186  ((x) == Owner(x)))
1187 #define Nospoof(x) ((Flags(x) & NOSPOOF) != 0)
1188 #define Safe(x, p) (OwnsOthers(x) || \
1189  (Flags(x) & SAFE) || \
1190  (mudconf.safe_unowned && (Owner(x) != Owner(p))))
1191 #define Control_ok(x) ((Flags2(x) & CONTROL_OK) != 0)
1192 #define Constant_Attrs(x) ((Flags2(x) & CONSTANT_ATTRS) != 0)
1193 #define Audible(x) ((Flags(x) & HEARTHRU) != 0)
1194 #define Terse(x) ((Flags(x) & TERSE) != 0)
1195 
1196 #define Gagged(x) ((Flags2(x) & GAGGED) != 0)
1197 #define Vacation(x) ((Flags2(x) & VACATION) != 0)
1198 #define Sending_Mail(x) ((Flags2(x) & PLAYER_MAILS) != 0)
1199 #define Key(x) ((Flags2(x) & KEY) != 0)
1200 #define Abode(x) (((Flags2(x) & ABODE) != 0) && Home_ok(x))
1201 #define Auditorium(x) ((Flags2(x) & AUDITORIUM) != 0)
1202 #define Findable(x) ((Flags2(x) & UNFINDABLE) == 0)
1203 #define Hideout(x) ((Flags2(x) & UNFINDABLE) != 0)
1204 #define Parent_ok(x) ((Flags2(x) & PARENT_OK) != 0)
1205 #define Light(x) ((Flags2(x) & LIGHT) != 0)
1206 #define Suspect(x) ((Flags2(Owner(x)) & SUSPECT) != 0)
1207 #define Watcher(x) ((Flags2(x) & WATCHER) != 0)
1208 #define Connected(x) (((Flags2(x) & CONNECTED) != 0) && \
1209  (Typeof(x) == TYPE_PLAYER))
1210 #define Slave(x) ((Flags2(Owner(x)) & SLAVE) != 0)
1211 #define ParentZone(x) ((Flags2(x) & ZONE_PARENT) != 0)
1212 #define Stop_Match(x) ((Flags2(x) & STOP_MATCH) != 0)
1213 #define Has_Commands(x) ((Flags2(x) & HAS_COMMANDS) != 0)
1214 #define Bouncer(x) ((Flags2(x) & BOUNCE) != 0)
1215 #define Hidden(x) ((Flags(x) & DARK) != 0)
1216 #define Blind(x) ((Flags2(x) & BLIND) != 0)
1217 #define Redir_ok(x) ((Flags3(x) & REDIR_OK) != 0)
1218 #define Orphan(x) ((Flags3(x) & ORPHAN) != 0)
1219 #define NoDefault(x) ((Flags3(x) & NODEFAULT) != 0)
1220 #define Unreal(x) ((Flags3(x) & PRESENCE) != 0)
1221 
1222 #define H_Startup(x) ((Flags(x) & HAS_STARTUP) != 0)
1223 #define H_Fwdlist(x) ((Flags2(x) & HAS_FWDLIST) != 0)
1224 #define H_Listen(x) ((Flags2(x) & HAS_LISTEN) != 0)
1225 #define H_Redirect(x) ((Flags3(x) & HAS_REDIRECT) != 0)
1226 #define H_Darklock(x) ((Flags3(x) & HAS_DARKLOCK) != 0)
1227 #define H_Speechmod(x) ((Flags3(x) & HAS_SPEECHMOD) != 0)
1228 #define H_Propdir(x) ((Flags3(x) & HAS_PROPDIR) != 0)
1229 
1230 #define H_Marker0(x) ((Flags3(x) & MARK_0) != 0)
1231 #define H_Marker1(x) ((Flags3(x) & MARK_1) != 0)
1232 #define H_Marker2(x) ((Flags3(x) & MARK_2) != 0)
1233 #define H_Marker3(x) ((Flags3(x) & MARK_3) != 0)
1234 #define H_Marker4(x) ((Flags3(x) & MARK_4) != 0)
1235 #define H_Marker5(x) ((Flags3(x) & MARK_5) != 0)
1236 #define H_Marker6(x) ((Flags3(x) & MARK_6) != 0)
1237 #define H_Marker7(x) ((Flags3(x) & MARK_7) != 0)
1238 #define H_Marker8(x) ((Flags3(x) & MARK_8) != 0)
1239 #define H_Marker9(x) ((Flags3(x) & MARK_9) != 0)
1240 #define isMarkerFlag(fp) (((fp)->flagflag & FLAG_WORD3) && \
1241  ((fp)->flagvalue & MARK_FLAGS))
1242 
1243 #define s_Halted(x) s_Flags((x), Flags(x) | HALT)
1244 #define s_Going(x) s_Flags((x), Flags(x) | GOING)
1245 #define s_Connected(x) s_Flags2((x), Flags2(x) | CONNECTED)
1246 #define c_Connected(x) s_Flags2((x), Flags2(x) & ~CONNECTED)
1247 #define isConnFlag(fp) (((fp)->flagflag & FLAG_WORD2) && \
1248  ((fp)->flagvalue & CONNECTED))
1249 #define s_Has_Darklock(x) s_Flags3((x), Flags3(x) | HAS_DARKLOCK)
1250 #define c_Has_Darklock(x) s_Flags3((x), Flags3(x) & ~HAS_DARKLOCK)
1251 #define s_Trace(x) s_Flags((x), Flags(x) | TRACE)
1252 #define c_Trace(x) s_Flags((x), Flags(x) & ~TRACE)
1253 
1254 #define Html(x) ((Flags2(x) & HTML) != 0)
1255 #define s_Html(x) s_Flags2((x), Flags2(x) | HTML)
1256 #define c_Html(x) s_Flags2((x), Flags2(x) & ~HTML)
1257 
1258 /*
1259  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1260  * Base control-oriented predicates.
1261  */
1262 
1263 #define Parentable(p, x) (Controls(p, x) || \
1264  (Parent_ok(x) && could_doit(p, x, A_LPARENT)))
1265 
1266 #define OnControlLock(p, x) (check_zone(p, x))
1267 
1268 #define Controls(p, x) (Good_obj(x) && \
1269  (!(God(x) && !God(p))) && \
1270  (Control_All(p) || \
1271  ((Owner(p) == Owner(x)) && \
1272  (Inherits(p) || !Inherits(x))) || \
1273  OnControlLock(p, x)))
1274 
1275 #define Cannot_Objeval(p, x) ((x == NOTHING) || God(x) || \
1276  (mudconf.fascist_objeval ? !Controls(p, x) : ((Owner(x) != Owner(p)) && !Wizard(p))))
1277 
1278 #define Has_power(p, x) (check_access((p), powers_nametab[x].flag))
1279 
1280 #define Mark(x) (mudstate.markbits->chunk[(x) >> 3] |= \
1281  mudconf.markdata[(x)&7])
1282 #define Unmark(x) (mudstate.markbits->chunk[(x) >> 3] &= \
1283  ~mudconf.markdata[(x)&7])
1284 #define Marked(x) (mudstate.markbits->chunk[(x) >> 3] & \
1285  mudconf.markdata[(x)&7])
1286 #define Mark_all(i) \
1287  for ((i) = 0; (i) < ((mudstate.db_top + 7) >> 3); (i)++) \
1288  mudstate.markbits->chunk[i] = (char)0xff
1289 #define Unmark_all(i) \
1290  for ((i) = 0; (i) < ((mudstate.db_top + 7) >> 3); (i)++) \
1291  mudstate.markbits->chunk[i] = (char)0x0
1292 
1293 /*
1294  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1295  * Visibility constraints.
1296  */
1297 
1298 #define Examinable(p, x) (((Flags(x) & VISUAL) != 0) || \
1299  (See_All(p)) || \
1300  (Owner(p) == Owner(x)) || \
1301  OnControlLock(p, x))
1302 
1303 #define MyopicExam(p, x) (((Flags(x) & VISUAL) != 0) || \
1304  (!Myopic(p) && (See_All(p) || \
1305  (Owner(p) == Owner(x)) || \
1306  OnControlLock(p, x))))
1307 
1308 /*
1309  * An object is considered Darkened if: It is set Dark. It does not have a
1310  * DarkLock set (no HAS_DARKLOCK flag on the object; an empty lock means the
1311  * player would pass the DarkLock), OR the player passes the DarkLock.
1312  * DarkLocks only apply when we are checking if we can see something on a
1313  * 'look'. They are not checked when matching, when looking at lexits(), when
1314  * determining whether a move is seen, on @sweep, etc.
1315  */
1316 
1317 #define Darkened(p, x) (Dark(x) && \
1318  (!H_Darklock(x) || could_doit(p, x, A_LDARK)))
1319 
1320 /*
1321  * For an object in a room, don't show if all of the following apply:
1322  * Sleeping players should not be seen. The thing is a disconnected player.
1323  * The player is not a puppet. You don't see yourself or exits. If a location
1324  * is not dark, you see it if it's not dark or you control it. If the
1325  * location is dark, you see it if you control it. Seeing your own dark
1326  * objects is controlled by mudconf.see_own_dark. In dark locations, you also
1327  * see things that are LIGHT and !DARK.
1328  */
1329 
1330 #define Sees(p, x) \
1331  (!Darkened(p, x) || (mudconf.see_own_dark && MyopicExam(p, x)))
1332 
1333 #define Sees_Always(p, x) \
1334  (!Darkened(p, x) || (mudconf.see_own_dark && Examinable(p, x)))
1335 
1336 #define Sees_In_Dark(p, x) ((Light(x) && !Darkened(p, x)) || \
1337  (mudconf.see_own_dark && MyopicExam(p, x)))
1338 
1339 #define Can_See(p, x, l) (!(((p) == (x)) || isExit(x) || \
1340  (mudconf.dark_sleepers && isPlayer(x) && \
1341  !Connected(x) && !Puppet(x))) && \
1342  ((l) ? Sees(p, x) : Sees_In_Dark(p, x)) && \
1343  ((!Unreal(x) || Check_Known(p, x)) && \
1344  (!Unreal(p) || Check_Knows(x, p))))
1345 
1346 #define Can_See_Exit(p, x, l) (!Darkened(p, x) && (!(l) || Light(x)) && \
1347  ((!Unreal(x) || Check_Known(p, x)) && \
1348  (!Unreal(p) || Check_Knows(x, p))))
1349 
1350 /*
1351  * For exits visible (for lexits(), etc.), this is true if we can examine the
1352  * exit's location, examine the exit, or the exit is LIGHT. It is also true
1353  * if neither the location or base or exit is dark.
1354  */
1355 
1356 #define VE_LOC_XAM 0x01 /* Location is examinable */
1357 #define VE_LOC_DARK 0x02 /* Location is dark */
1358 #define VE_BASE_DARK 0x04 /* Base location (pre-parent) is dark */
1359 
1360 #define Exit_Visible(x, p, k) \
1361  (((k)&VE_LOC_XAM) || Examinable(p, x) || Light(x) || \
1362  (!((k) & (VE_LOC_DARK | VE_BASE_DARK)) && !Dark(x)))
1363 
1364 /*
1365  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1366  * Linking.
1367  */
1368 
1369 /* Can I link this exit to something else? */
1370 #define Link_exit(p, x) ((Typeof(x) == TYPE_EXIT) && \
1371  ((Location(x) == NOTHING) || Controls(p, x)))
1372 
1373 /*
1374  * Is this something I can link to? - It must be a valid object, and be able
1375  * to have contents. - I must control it, or have it be Link_ok, or I must
1376  * the link_to_any power and not have the destination be God.
1377  */
1378 #define Linkable(p, x) (Good_obj(x) && Has_contents(x) && \
1379  (Controls(p, x) || Link_ok(x) || \
1380  (LinkToAny(p) && !God(x))))
1381 
1382 /*
1383  * Can I pass the linklock check on this? - I must have link_to_any (or be a
1384  * wizard) and wizards must ignore linklocks, OR - I must be able to pass the
1385  * linklock.
1386  */
1387 #define Passes_Linklock(p, x) \
1388  ((LinkToAny(p) && !mudconf.wiz_obey_linklock) || \
1389  could_doit(p, x, A_LLINK))
1390 
1391 /*
1392  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1393  * Attribute visibility and write permissions.
1394  */
1395 
1396 #define AttrFlags(a, f) ((f) | (a)->flags)
1397 
1398 #define Visible_desc(p, x, a) \
1399  (((a)->number != A_DESC) || mudconf.read_rem_desc || nearby(p, x))
1400 
1401 #define Invisible_attr(p, x, a, o, f) \
1402  ((!Examinable(p, x) && (Owner(p) != o)) || \
1403  ((AttrFlags(a, f) & AF_MDARK) && !Sees_Hidden_Attrs(p)) || \
1404  ((AttrFlags(a, f) & AF_DARK) && !God(p)))
1405 
1406 #define Visible_attr(p, x, a, o, f) \
1407  (((AttrFlags(a, f) & AF_VISUAL) && Visible_desc(p, x, a)) || \
1408  !Invisible_attr(p, x, a, o, f))
1409 
1410 #define See_attr(p, x, a, o, f) \
1411  (!((a)->flags & (AF_INTERNAL | AF_IS_LOCK)) && !(f & AF_STRUCTURE) && \
1412  Visible_attr(p, x, a, o, f))
1413 
1414 #define Read_attr(p, x, a, o, f) \
1415  (!((a)->flags & AF_INTERNAL) && !(f & AF_STRUCTURE) && \
1416  Visible_attr(p, x, a, o, f))
1417 
1418 #define See_attr_all(p, x, a, o, f, y) \
1419  (!((a)->flags & (AF_INTERNAL | AF_IS_LOCK)) && \
1420  ((y) || !(f & AF_STRUCTURE)) && \
1421  Visible_attr(p, x, a, o, f))
1422 
1423 #define Read_attr_all(p, x, a, o, f, y) \
1424  (!((a)->flags & AF_INTERNAL) && \
1425  ((y) || !(f & AF_STRUCTURE)) && \
1426  Visible_attr(p, x, a, o, f))
1427 
1428 /*
1429  * We can set it if: The (master) attribute is not internal or a lock AND
1430  * we're God OR we meet the following criteria: - The object is not God. -
1431  * The attribute on the object is not locked. - The object is not set
1432  * Constant. - We control the object, and the attribute and master attribute
1433  * do not have the Wizard or God flags, OR We are a Wizard and the attribute
1434  * and master attribute do not have the God flags.
1435  */
1436 
1437 #define Set_attr(p, x, a, f) \
1438  (!((a)->flags & (AF_INTERNAL | AF_IS_LOCK | AF_CONST)) && \
1439  (God(p) || \
1440  (!God(x) && !((f)&AF_LOCK) && !Constant_Attrs(x) && \
1441  ((Controls(p, x) && \
1442  !((a)->flags & (AF_WIZARD | AF_GOD)) && \
1443  !((f) & (AF_WIZARD | AF_GOD))) || \
1444  (Sets_Wiz_Attrs(p) && !((a)->flags & AF_GOD) && !((f)&AF_GOD))))))
1445 
1446 /*
1447  * Write_attr() is only used by atr_cpy(), and thus is not subject to the
1448  * effects of the Constant flag.
1449  */
1450 
1451 #define Write_attr(p, x, a, f) \
1452  (!((a)->flags & (AF_INTERNAL | AF_NOCLONE)) && \
1453  (God(p) || \
1454  (!God(x) && !(f & AF_LOCK) && \
1455  ((Controls(p, x) && \
1456  !((a)->flags & (AF_WIZARD | AF_GOD)) && \
1457  !((f) & (AF_WIZARD | AF_GOD))) || \
1458  (Sets_Wiz_Attrs(p) && \
1459  !((a)->flags & AF_GOD))))))
1460 
1461 /*
1462  * We can lock/unlock it if: we're God OR we meet the following criteria: -
1463  * The (master) attribute is not internal or a lock AND - The object is not
1464  * God. - The object is not set Constant. - The master attribute does not
1465  * have the Wizard or God flags, OR We are a Wizard and the master attribute
1466  * does not have the God flag. - We are a Wizard OR we own the attribute.
1467  */
1468 
1469 #define Lock_attr(p, x, a, o) \
1470  (God(p) || \
1471  (!God(x) && \
1472  !((a)->flags & (AF_INTERNAL | AF_IS_LOCK | AF_CONST)) && \
1473  !Constant_Attrs(x) && \
1474  (!((a)->flags & (AF_WIZARD | AF_GOD)) || \
1475  (Sets_Wiz_Attrs(p) && !((a)->flags & AF_GOD))) && \
1476  (Wizard(p) || (o) == Owner(p))))
1477 
1478 /* Visibility abstractions */
1479 
1480 #define Are_Real(p, t) (!(Unreal(p) || Unreal(t)))
1481 #define Check_Heard(t, p) (could_doit((t), (p), A_LHEARD))
1482 #define Check_Noticed(t, p) (could_doit((t), (p), A_LMOVED))
1483 #define Check_Known(t, p) (could_doit((t), (p), A_LKNOWN))
1484 #define Check_Hears(p, t) (could_doit((p), (t), A_LHEARS))
1485 #define Check_Notices(p, t) (could_doit((p), (t), A_LMOVES))
1486 #define Check_Knows(p, t) (could_doit((p), (t), A_LKNOWS))
1487 
1488 #endif /* __FLAGS_H */
1489 
1490 
1491 /*
1492  * From htab.h
1493  */
1494 
1495 #ifndef __HTAB_H
1496 #define __HTAB_H
1497 
1498 typedef union
1499 {
1500  char *s;
1501  int i;
1502 } HASHKEY;
1503 
1504 typedef struct hashentry HASHENT;
1505 struct hashentry
1506 {
1507  HASHKEY target;
1508  int *data;
1509  int flags;
1510  struct hashentry *next;
1511 };
1512 #define NHSHENT HASHENT
1513 
1514 typedef struct hashtable HASHTAB;
1515 struct hashtable
1516 {
1517  int hashsize;
1518  int mask;
1519  int checks;
1520  int scans;
1521  int max_scan;
1522  int hits;
1523  int entries;
1524  int deletes;
1525  int nulls;
1526  int flags;
1527  HASHENT **entry;
1528  int last_hval; /* Used for hashfirst & hashnext. */
1529  HASHENT *last_entry; /* like last_hval */
1530 };
1531 #define NHSHTAB HASHTAB
1532 
1533 typedef struct mod_hashes MODHASHES;
1534 struct mod_hashes
1535 {
1536  char *tabname;
1537  HASHTAB *htab;
1538  int size_factor;
1539  int min_size;
1540 };
1541 #define MODNHASHES MODHASHES
1542 
1546 typedef struct name_table
1547 {
1548  char *name;
1549  int minlen;
1550  int perm;
1551  int flag;
1552 } NAMETAB;
1553 
1554 /* Hash entry flags */
1555 
1556 #define HASH_ALIAS 0x00000001 /* This entry is just a copy */
1557 
1558 /* Hash table flags */
1559 
1560 #define HT_STR 0x00000000 /* String-keyed hashtable */
1561 #define HT_NUM 0x00000001 /* Numeric-keyed hashtable */
1562 #define HT_TYPEMASK 0x0000000f /* Reserve up to 16 key types */
1563 #define HT_KEYREF 0x00000010 /* Store keys by reference not copy */
1564 
1565 #define nhashinit(h, sz) hashinit((h), (sz), HT_NUM)
1566 #define nhashreset(h) hashreset((h))
1567 #define hashfind(s, h) hashfind_generic((HASHKEY)(s), (h))
1568 #define nhashfind(n, h) hashfind_generic((HASHKEY)(n), (h))
1569 #define hashfindflags(s, h) hashfindflags_generic((HASHKEY)(s), (h))
1570 #define hashadd(s, d, h, f) hashadd_generic((HASHKEY)(s), (d), (h), (f))
1571 #define nhashadd(n, d, h) hashadd_generic((HASHKEY)(n), (d), (h), 0)
1572 #define hashdelete(s, h) hashdelete_generic((HASHKEY)(s), (h))
1573 #define nhashdelete(n, h) hashdelete_generic((HASHKEY)(n), (h))
1574 #define nhashflush(h, sz) hashflush((h), (sz))
1575 #define hashrepl(s, d, h) hashrepl_generic((HASHKEY)(s), (d), (h))
1576 #define nhashrepl(n, d, h) hashrepl_generic((HASHKEY)(n), (d), (h))
1577 #define nhashinfo(t, h) hashinfo((t), (h))
1578 #define hash_firstkey(h) (hash_firstkey_generic((h)).s)
1579 #define hash_nextkey(h) (hash_nextkey_generic((h)).s)
1580 #define nhashresize(h, sz) hashresize((h), (sz))
1581 
1582 #endif /* __HTAB_H */
1583 
1584 
1585 /*
1586  * From udb.h
1587  */
1588 
1589 #ifndef __UDB_H
1590 #define __UDB_H
1591 
1592 /*-
1593  * Copyright (c) 1990 The Regents of the University of California.
1594  * All rights reserved.
1595  *
1596  * This code is derived from software contributed to Berkeley by
1597  * Margo Seltzer.
1598  *
1599  *
1600  * Redistribution and use in source and binary forms are permitted provided
1601  * that: (1) source distributions retain this entire copyright notice and
1602  * comment, and (2) distributions including binaries display the following
1603  * acknowledgement: ``This product includes software developed by the
1604  * University of California, Berkeley and its contributors'' in the
1605  * documentation or other materials provided with the distribution and in
1606  * all advertising materials mentioning features or use of this software.
1607  * Neither the name of the University nor the names of its contributors may
1608  * be used to endorse or promote products derived from this software without
1609  * specific prior written permission.
1610  * THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED ``AS IS'' AND WITHOUT ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED
1611  * WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF
1612  * MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
1613  */
1614 
1615 /* Define the number of objects we may be reading/writing to at one time */
1616 
1617 #define NUM_OBJPIPES 64
1618 
1619 /* For MUSH, an int works great as an object ID
1620  * And attributes are zero terminated strings, so we heave the size out.
1621  * We hand around attribute identifiers in the last things.
1622  */
1623 
1624 typedef char Attr;
1625 
1626 typedef unsigned int Objname;
1627 
1628 typedef struct Aname
1629 {
1630  unsigned int object;
1631  unsigned int attrnum;
1632 } Aname;
1633 
1634 /* In general, we want binary attributes, so we do this. */
1635 
1636 typedef struct Attrib
1637 {
1638  int attrnum; /* MUSH specific identifier */
1639  int size;
1640  char *data;
1641 } Attrib;
1642 
1643 /* An object is a name, an attribute count, and a vector of attributes */
1644 /* which Attr's are stowed in a contiguous array pointed at by atrs. */
1645 
1646 typedef struct Obj
1647 {
1648  Objname name;
1649  time_t counter;
1650  int dirty;
1651  int at_count;
1652  Attrib *atrs;
1653 } Obj;
1654 
1655 typedef struct cache
1656 {
1657  void *keydata;
1658  int keylen;
1659  void *data;
1660  int datalen;
1661  unsigned int type;
1662  unsigned int flags;
1663  struct cache *nxt;
1664  struct cache *prvfree;
1665  struct cache *nxtfree;
1666 } Cache;
1667 
1668 typedef struct
1669 {
1670  Cache *head;
1671  Cache *tail;
1672 } Chain;
1673 
1674 typedef struct
1675 {
1676  void *dptr;
1677  int dsize;
1678 } DBData;
1679 
1680 /* Cache flags */
1681 
1682 #define CACHE_DIRTY 0x00000001
1683 
1684 #endif /* __UDB_H */
1685 
1686 
1687 /*
1688  * From udb_defs.h
1689  */
1690 
1691 #ifndef __UDB_DEFS_H
1692 #define __UDB_DEFS_H
1693 
1694 /* If your malloc() returns void or char pointers... */
1695 /* typedef void *mall_t; */
1696 typedef char *mall_t;
1697 
1698 /* default (runtime-resettable) cache parameters */
1699 
1700 #define CACHE_SIZE 1000000 /* 1 million bytes */
1701 #define CACHE_WIDTH 200
1702 
1703 /* Datatypes that we have in cache and on disk */
1704 
1705 #define DBTYPE_EMPTY 0 /* This entry is empty */
1706 #define DBTYPE_ATTRIBUTE 1 /* This is an attribute */
1707 #define DBTYPE_DBINFO 2 /* Various DB paramaters */
1708 #define DBTYPE_OBJECT 3 /* Object structure */
1709 #define DBTYPE_ATRNUM 4 /* Attribute number to name map */
1710 #define DBTYPE_MODULETYPE 5 /* DBTYPE to module name map */
1711 #define DBTYPE_RESERVED 0x0000FFFF /* Numbers >= are free for \
1712  * use by user code (modules) */
1713 #define DBTYPE_END 0xFFFFFFFF /* Highest type */
1714 
1715 #endif /* __UDB_DEFS_H */
1716 
1717 
1718 /*
1719  * From mushconf.h
1720  */
1721 
1722 #ifndef __MUSHCONF_H
1723 #define __MUSHCONF_H
1724 
1725 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1726  * Modules and related things.
1727  */
1728 
1729 typedef struct module_version_info MODVER;
1730 struct module_version_info
1731 {
1732  char *version;
1733  char *author;
1734  char *email;
1735  char *url;
1736  char *description;
1737  char *copyright;
1738 };
1739 
1740 typedef struct module_linked_list MODULE;
1741 struct module_linked_list
1742 {
1743  char *modname;
1744  lt_dlhandle handle;
1745  struct module_linked_list *next;
1746  int (*process_command)(dbref, dbref, int, char *, char *[], int);
1747  int (*process_no_match)(dbref, dbref, int, char *, char *, char *[], int);
1748  int (*did_it)(dbref, dbref, dbref, int, const char *, int, const char *, int, int, char *[], int, int);
1749  void (*create_obj)(dbref, dbref);
1750  void (*destroy_obj)(dbref, dbref);
1751  void (*create_player)(dbref, dbref, int, int);
1752  void (*destroy_player)(dbref, dbref);
1753  void (*announce_connect)(dbref, const char *, int);
1754  void (*announce_disconnect)(dbref, const char *, int);
1755  void (*examine)(dbref, dbref, dbref, int, int);
1756  void (*dump_database)(FILE *);
1757  void (*db_write)(void);
1758  void (*db_grow)(int, int);
1759  void (*db_write_flatfile)(FILE *);
1760  void (*do_second)(void);
1761  void (*cache_put_notify)(DBData, unsigned int);
1762  void (*cache_del_notify)(DBData, unsigned int);
1763  MODVER (*version)
1764  (dbref, dbref, int);
1765 };
1766 
1767 typedef struct api_function_data API_FUNCTION;
1768 struct api_function_data
1769 {
1770  const char *name;
1771  const char *param_fmt;
1772  void (*handler)(void *, void *);
1773 };
1774 
1775 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
1776  * CONFDATA: runtime configurable parameters
1777  */
1778 
1779 typedef struct confparm CONF;
1780 struct confparm
1781 {
1782  char *pname; /* parm name */
1783  int (*interpreter)(); /* routine to interp parameter */
1784  int flags; /* control flags */
1785  int rperms; /* read permission flags */
1786  int *loc; /* where to store value */
1787  long extra; /* extra data for interpreter */
1788 };
1789 
1790 typedef struct confdata CONFDATA;
1791 struct confdata
1792 {
1793  int cache_size; /* Maximum size of cache */
1794  int cache_width; /* Number of cache cells */
1795  int paylimit; /* getting money gets hard over this much */
1796  int digcost; /* cost of @dig command */
1797  int linkcost; /* cost of @link command */
1798  int opencost; /* cost of @open command */
1799  int robotcost; /* cost of @robot command */
1800  int createmin; /* default (and minimum) cost of @create cmd */
1801  int createmax; /* max cost of @create command */
1802  int quotas; /* TRUE = have building quotas */
1803  int room_quota; /* quota needed to make a room */
1804  int exit_quota; /* quota needed to make an exit */
1805  int thing_quota; /* quota needed to make a thing */
1806  int player_quota; /* quota needed to make a robot player */
1807  int sacfactor; /* sacrifice earns (obj_cost/sfactor) + sadj */
1808  int sacadjust; /* ... */
1809  dbref start_room; /* initial location for non-Guest players */
1810  dbref start_home; /* initial HOME for players */
1811  dbref default_home; /* HOME when home is inaccessible */
1812  dbref guest_start_room; /* initial location for Guests */
1813  int vattr_flags; /* Attr flags for all user-defined attrs */
1814  KEYLIST *vattr_flag_list; /* Linked list, for attr_type conf */
1815  int log_options; /* What gets logged */
1816  int log_info; /* Info that goes into log entries */
1817  int log_diversion; /* What logs get diverted? */
1818  Uchar markdata[8]; /* Masks for marking/unmarking */
1819  int ntfy_nest_lim; /* Max nesting of notifys */
1820  int fwdlist_lim; /* Max objects in @forwardlist */
1821  int propdir_lim; /* Max objects in @propdir */
1822  int dbopt_interval; /* Optimize db every N dumps */
1823  char *dbhome; /* Database home directory */
1824  char *txthome; /* Text files home directory */
1825  char *binhome; /* Binary home directory */
1826  char *bakhome; /* Backup home directory */
1827  char *status_file; /* Where to write arg to @shutdown */
1828  char *config_file; /* MUSH's config file */
1829  char *config_home; /* MUSH's config directory */
1830  char *log_file; /* MUSH's log file */
1831  char *log_home; /* MUSH's log directory */
1832  char *pid_file; /* MUSH's pid file */
1833  char *pid_home; /* MUSH's pid directory */
1834  char *db_file; /* MUSH's db file */
1835  char *backup_exec; /* Executable run to tar files */
1836  char *backup_compress; /* Flags used to compress */
1837  char *backup_extract; /* Flags used to extract */
1838  char *backup_ext; /* Filename extension for backup */
1839  char *mudowner; /* Email of the game owner */
1840  char *modules_home; /* Base path for modules */
1841  char *game_exec; /* MUSH's executable full path and name */
1842  char *game_home; /* MUSH's working directory */
1843  char *scripts_home; /* MUSH's scripts directory */
1844  int have_pueblo; /* Is Pueblo support compiled in? */
1845  int have_zones; /* Should zones be active? */
1846  int port; /* user port */
1847  int conc_port; /* concentrator port */
1848  int init_size; /* initial db size */
1849  int output_block_size; /* Block size of output */
1850  int use_global_aconn; /* Do we want to use global @aconn code? */
1851  int global_aconn_uselocks; /* global @aconn obeys uselocks? */
1852  int have_guest; /* Do we wish to allow a GUEST character? */
1853  int guest_char; /* player num of prototype GUEST character */
1854  int guest_nuker; /* Wiz who nukes the GUEST characters. */
1855  int number_guests; /* number of guest characters allowed */
1856  char *guest_basename; /* Base name or alias for guest char */
1857  char *guest_prefixes; /* Prefixes for the guest char's name */
1858  char *guest_suffixes; /* Suffixes for the guest char's name */
1859  char *guest_password; /* Default password for guests */
1860  char *help_users; /* Help file for users */
1861  char *help_wizards; /* Help file for wizards and god */
1862  char *help_quick; /* Quick help file */
1863  char *guest_file; /* display if guest connects */
1864  char *conn_file; /* display on connect if no registration */
1865  char *creg_file; /* display on connect if registration */
1866  char *regf_file; /* display on (failed) create if reg is on */
1867  char *motd_file; /* display this file on login */
1868  char *wizmotd_file; /* display this file on login to wizards */
1869  char *quit_file; /* display on quit */
1870  char *down_file; /* display this file if no logins */
1871  char *full_file; /* display when max users exceeded */
1872  char *site_file; /* display if conn from bad site */
1873  char *crea_file; /* display this on login for new users */
1874  char *motd_msg; /* Wizard-settable login message */
1875  char *wizmotd_msg; /* Login message for wizards only */
1876  char *downmotd_msg; /* Settable 'logins disabled' message */
1877  char *fullmotd_msg; /* Settable 'Too many players' message */
1878  char *dump_msg; /* Message displayed when @dump-ing */
1879  char *postdump_msg; /* Message displayed after @dump-ing */
1880  char *fixed_home_msg; /* Message displayed when going home and FIXED */
1881  char *fixed_tel_msg; /* Message displayed when teleporting and FIXED */
1882  char *huh_msg; /* Message displayed when a Huh? is gotten */
1883  char *pueblo_msg; /* Message displayed to Pueblo clients */
1884  char *pueblo_version; /* Message displayed to indicate Pueblo's capabilities */
1885  char *htmlconn_file; /* display on PUEBLOCLIENT message */
1886  char *exec_path; /* argv[0] */
1887  LINKEDLIST *infotext_list; /* Linked list of INFO fields and values */
1888  int indent_desc; /* Newlines before and after descs? */
1889  int name_spaces; /* allow player names to have spaces */
1890  int site_chars; /* where to truncate site name */
1891  int fork_dump; /* perform dump in a forked process */
1892  int fork_vfork; /* use vfork to fork */
1893  int sig_action; /* What to do with fatal signals */
1894  int max_players; /* Max # of connected players */
1895  int dump_interval; /* interval between checkpoint dumps in secs */
1896  int check_interval; /* interval between db check/cleans in secs */
1897  int events_daily_hour; /* At what hour should @daily be executed? */
1898  int dump_offset; /* when to take first checkpoint dump */
1899  int check_offset; /* when to perform first check and clean */
1900  int idle_timeout; /* Boot off players idle this long in secs */
1901  int conn_timeout; /* Allow this long to connect before booting */
1902  int idle_interval; /* when to check for idle users */
1903  int retry_limit; /* close conn after this many bad logins */
1904  int output_limit; /* Max # chars queued for output */
1905  int paycheck; /* players earn this much each day connected */
1906  int paystart; /* new players start with this much money */
1907  int start_quota; /* Quota for new players */
1908  int start_room_quota; /* Room quota for new players */
1909  int start_exit_quota; /* Exit quota for new players */
1910  int start_thing_quota; /* Thing quota for new players */
1911  int start_player_quota; /* Player quota for new players */
1912  int payfind; /* chance to find a penny with wandering */
1913  int killmin; /* default (and minimum) cost of kill cmd */
1914  int killmax; /* max cost of kill command */
1915  int killguarantee; /* cost of kill cmd that guarantees success */
1916  int pagecost; /* cost of @page command */
1917  int searchcost; /* cost of commands that search the whole DB */
1918  int waitcost; /* cost of @wait (refunded when finishes) */
1919  int building_limit; /* max number of objects in the db */
1920  int queuemax; /* max commands a player may have in queue */
1921  int queue_chunk; /* # cmds to run from queue when idle */
1922  int active_q_chunk; /* # cmds to run from queue when active */
1923  int machinecost; /* One in mc+1 cmds costs 1 penny (POW2-1) */
1924  int clone_copy_cost; /* Does @clone copy value? */
1925  int use_hostname; /* TRUE = use machine NAME rather than quad */
1926  int typed_quotas; /* TRUE = use quotas by type */
1927  int ex_flags; /* TRUE = show flags on examine */
1928  int robot_speak; /* TRUE = allow robots to speak in public */
1929  int pub_flags; /* TRUE = flags() works on anything */
1930  int quiet_look; /* TRUE = don't see attribs when looking */
1931  int exam_public; /* Does EXAM show public attrs by default? */
1932  int read_rem_desc; /* Can the DESCs of nonlocal objs be read? */
1933  int read_rem_name; /* Can the NAMEs of nonlocal objs be read? */
1934  int sweep_dark; /* Can you sweep dark places? */
1935  int player_listen; /* Are AxHEAR triggered on players? */
1936  int quiet_whisper; /* Can others tell when you whisper? */
1937  int dark_sleepers; /* Are sleeping players 'dark'? */
1938  int see_own_dark; /* Do you see your own dark stuff? */
1939  int idle_wiz_dark; /* Do idling wizards get set dark? */
1940  int visible_wizzes; /* Do dark wizards show up on contents? */
1941  int pemit_players; /* Can you @pemit to faraway players? */
1942  int pemit_any; /* Can you @pemit to ANY remote object? */
1943  int addcmd_match_blindly; /* Does @addcommand produce a Huh? if syntax issues mean no wildcard is matched? */
1944  int addcmd_obey_stop; /* Does @addcommand still multiple match on STOP objs? */
1945  int addcmd_obey_uselocks; /* Does @addcommand obey uselocks? */
1946  int lattr_oldstyle; /* Bad lattr() return empty or #-1 NO MATCH? */
1947  int bools_oldstyle; /* TinyMUSH 2.x and TinyMUX bools */
1948  int match_mine; /* Should you check yourself for $-commands? */
1949  int match_mine_pl; /* Should players check selves for $-cmds? */
1950  int switch_df_all; /* Should @switch match all by default? */
1951  int fascist_objeval; /* Does objeval() require victim control? */
1952  int fascist_tport; /* Src of teleport must be owned/JUMP_OK */
1953  int terse_look; /* Does manual look obey TERSE */
1954  int terse_contents; /* Does TERSE look show exits */
1955  int terse_exits; /* Does TERSE look show obvious exits */
1956  int terse_movemsg; /* Show move msgs (SUCC/LEAVE/etc) if TERSE? */
1957  int trace_topdown; /* Is TRACE output top-down or bottom-up? */
1958  int safe_unowned; /* Are objects not owned by you safe? */
1959  int trace_limit; /* Max lines of trace output if top-down */
1960  int wiz_obey_linklock; /* Do wizards obey linklocks? */
1961  int local_masters; /* Do we check Zone rooms as local masters? */
1962  int match_zone_parents; /* Objects in local master rooms inherit commands from their parents, just like normal? */
1963  int req_cmds_flag; /* COMMANDS flag required to check $-cmds? */
1964  int ansi_colors; /* allow ANSI colors? */
1965  int safer_passwords; /* enforce reasonably good password choices? */
1966  int space_compress; /* Convert multiple spaces into one space */
1967  int instant_recycle; /* Do destroy_ok objects get insta-nuke? */
1968  int dark_actions; /* Trigger @a-actions even when dark? */
1969  int no_ambiguous_match; /* match_result() -> last_match_result() */
1970  int exit_calls_move; /* Matching an exit in the main command parser invokes the 'move' command. */
1971  int move_match_more; /* Exit matches in 'move' parse like the main command parser (local, global, zone; pick random on ambiguous). */
1972  int autozone; /* New objs are zoned to creator's zone */
1973  int page_req_equals; /* page command must always contain '=' */
1974  int comma_say; /* Use grammatically-correct comma in says */
1975  int you_say; /* Show 'You say' to the player */
1976  int c_cmd_subst; /* Is %c last command or ansi? */
1977  int player_name_min; /* Minimum length of a player name */
1978  dbref master_room; /* Room containing default cmds/exits/etc */
1979  dbref player_proto; /* Player prototype to clone */
1980  dbref room_proto; /* Room prototype to clone */
1981  dbref exit_proto; /* Exit prototype to clone */
1982  dbref thing_proto; /* Thing prototype to clone */
1983  dbref player_defobj; /* Players use this for attr template */
1984  dbref room_defobj; /* Rooms use this for attr template */
1985  dbref exit_defobj; /* Exits use this for attr template */
1986  dbref thing_defobj; /* Things use this for attr template */
1987  dbref player_parent; /* Parent that players start with */
1988  dbref room_parent; /* Parent that rooms start with */
1989  dbref exit_parent; /* Parent that exits start with */
1990  dbref thing_parent; /* Parent that things start with */
1991  FLAGSET player_flags; /* Flags players start with */
1992  FLAGSET room_flags; /* Flags rooms start with */
1993  FLAGSET exit_flags; /* Flags exits start with */
1994  FLAGSET thing_flags; /* Flags things start with */
1995  FLAGSET robot_flags; /* Flags robots start with */
1996  FLAGSET stripped_flags; /* Flags stripped by @clone and @chown */
1997  char *flag_sep; /* Separator of dbref from marker flags */
1998  char *mud_name; /* Name of the mud */
1999  char *mud_shortname; /* Shorter name, for log */
2000  char *one_coin; /* name of one coin (ie. "penny") */
2001  char *many_coins; /* name of many coins (ie. "pennies") */
2002  int timeslice; /* How often do we bump people's cmd quotas? */
2003  int cmd_quota_max; /* Max commands at one time */
2004  int cmd_quota_incr; /* Bump #cmds allowed by this each timeslice */
2005  int lag_check; /* Is CPU usage checking compiled in? */
2006  int lag_check_clk; /* track object use time with wall-clock (need lag_check == true) */
2007  int lag_check_cpu; /* track object use time with getrusage() instead of wall-clock (need lag_check_clk == true) */
2008  int malloc_logger; /* log allocation of memory */
2009  int max_global_regs; /* How many global register are avalable (min 10, max 36) */
2010  int max_command_args; /* Maximum arguments a command may have */
2011  int player_name_length; /* Maximum length of a player name */
2012  int hash_factor; /* Hash factor */
2013  int max_cmdsecs; /* Threshhold for real time taken by command */
2014  int control_flags; /* Global runtime control flags */
2015  int wild_times_lim; /* Max recursions in wildcard match */
2016  int cmd_nest_lim; /* Max nesting of commands like @switch/now */
2017  int cmd_invk_lim; /* Max commands in one queue entry */
2018  int func_nest_lim; /* Max nesting of functions */
2019  int func_invk_lim; /* Max funcs invoked by a command */
2020  int func_cpu_lim_secs; /* Max secs of func CPU time by a cmd */
2021  clock_t func_cpu_lim; /* Max clock ticks of func CPU time by a cmd */
2022  int lock_nest_lim; /* Max nesting of lock evals */
2023  int parent_nest_lim; /* Max levels of parents */
2024  int zone_nest_lim; /* Max nesting of zones */
2025  int numvars_lim; /* Max number of variables per object */
2026  int stack_lim; /* Max number of items on an object stack */
2027  int struct_lim; /* Max number of defined structures for obj */
2028  int instance_lim; /* Max number of struct instances for obj */
2029  int max_grid_size; /* Maximum cells in a grid */
2030  int max_player_aliases; /* Max number of aliases for a player */
2031  int register_limit; /* Max number of named q-registers */
2032  int max_qpid; /* Max total number of queue entries */
2033  char *struct_dstr; /* Delim string used for struct 'examine' */
2034 };
2035

2041 
2042 typedef struct site_data SITE;

2044 {
2045  struct site_data *next; /* Next site in chain */

2047  struct in_addr mask; /* Mask to apply before comparing */
2048  int flag; /* Value to return on match */
2049 };
2050 
2051 typedef struct objlist_block OBLOCK;
2052 struct objlist_block
2053 {
2054  struct objlist_block *next;
2055  dbref data[(LBUF_SIZE - sizeof(OBLOCK *)) / sizeof(dbref)];
2056 };
2057 
2058 #define OBLOCK_SIZE (int)((LBUF_SIZE - sizeof(OBLOCK *)) / sizeof(dbref))
2059 
2060 typedef struct objlist_stack OLSTK;
2061 struct objlist_stack
2062 {
2063  struct objlist_stack *next; /* Next object list in stack */
2064  OBLOCK *head; /* Head of object list */
2065  OBLOCK *tail; /* Tail of object list */
2066  OBLOCK *cblock; /* Current block for scan */
2067  int count; /* Number of objs in last obj list block */
2068  int citm; /* Current item for scan */
2069 };
2070 
2071 typedef struct markbuf MARKBUF;
2072 struct markbuf
2073 {
2074  char chunk[5000];
2075 };
2076

2079 {

2082  struct alist *next;
2083 };
