2106 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2107  * State data.
2108  */
2109 
2110 typedef struct
2111 {
2112  /* Version number is Major.Minor.Status.PatchLevel */
2113  char *name; /* Complete version string */
2114  int major; /* Major Version */
2115  int minor; /* Minor Version */
2116  int status; /* Status : 0 - Alpha, 1 - Beta, 2 - Release Candidate, 3 - Gamma */
2117  int revision; /* Patch Level */
2118 } versioninfo;
2119 
2120 typedef struct statedata STATEDATA;
2121 struct statedata
2122 {
2123  int record_players; /* The maximum # of player logged on */
2124  int db_block_size; /* Block size of database */
2125  Obj *objpipes[NUM_OBJPIPES]; /* Number of object pipelines */
2126  unsigned int objc; /* Object reference counter */
2127  versioninfo version; /* MUSH version info */
2128  char *configureinfo; /* Configure switches */
2129  char *compilerinfo; /* Compiler command line */
2130  char *linkerinfo; /* Linker command line */
2131  char *modloaded; /* Modules loaded */
2132  char **cfiletab; /* Array of config files */
2133  int configfiles; /* Number of config files */
2134  int initializing; /* Are we reading config file at startup? */
2135  int loading_db; /* Are we loading the db? */
2136  int standalone; /* Are we converting the database? */
2137  int panicking; /* Are we in the middle of dying horribly? */
2138  int restarting; /* Are we restarting? */
2139  int dumping; /* Are we dumping? */
2140  int logstderr; /* Echo log to stderr too? */
2141  int debug; /* Are we being debug? */
2142  pid_t dumper; /* If forked-dumping, with what pid? */
2143  int logging; /* Are we in the middle of logging? */
2144  int epoch; /* Generation number for dumps */
2145  int generation; /* DB global generation number */
2146  int mudlognum; /* Number of logfile */
2147  int helpfiles; /* Number of external indexed helpfiles */
2148  int hfiletab_size; /* Size of the table storing path pointers */
2149  char **hfiletab; /* Array of path pointers */
2150  HASHTAB *hfile_hashes; /* Pointer to an array of index hashtables */
2151  dbref curr_enactor; /* Who initiated the current command */
2152  dbref curr_player; /* Who is running the current command */
2153  char *curr_cmd; /* The current command */
2154  int alarm_triggered; /* Has periodic alarm signal occurred? */
2155  time_t now; /* What time is it now? */
2156  time_t dump_counter; /* Countdown to next db dump */
2157  time_t check_counter; /* Countdown to next db check */
2158  time_t idle_counter; /* Countdown to next idle check */
2159  time_t mstats_counter; /* Countdown to next mstats snapshot */
2160  time_t events_counter; /* Countdown to next events check */
2161  int shutdown_flag; /* Should interface be shut down? */
2162  int flatfile_flag; /* Dump a flatfile when we have the chance */
2163  time_t start_time; /* When was MUSH started */
2164  time_t restart_time; /* When did we last restart? */
2165  int reboot_nums; /* How many times have we restarted? */
2166  time_t cpu_count_from; /* When did we last reset CPU counters? */
2167  char *debug_cmd; /* The command we are executing (if any) */
2168  char *doing_hdr; /* Doing column header in WHO display */
2169  SITE *access_list; /* Access states for sites */
2170  SITE *suspect_list; /* Sites that are suspect */
2171  HASHTAB command_htab; /* Commands hashtable */
2172  HASHTAB logout_cmd_htab; /* Logged-out commands hashtable (WHO, etc) */
2173  HASHTAB func_htab; /* Functions hashtable */
2174  HASHTAB ufunc_htab; /* Local functions hashtable */
2175  HASHTAB powers_htab; /* Powers hashtable */
2176  HASHTAB flags_htab; /* Flags hashtable */
2177  HASHTAB attr_name_htab; /* Attribute names hashtable */
2178  HASHTAB vattr_name_htab; /* User attribute names hashtable */
2179  HASHTAB player_htab; /* Player name->number hashtable */
2180  HASHTAB nref_htab; /* Object name reference #_name_ mapping */
2181  NHSHTAB desc_htab; /* Socket descriptor hashtable */
2182  NHSHTAB fwdlist_htab; /* Room forwardlists */
2183  NHSHTAB propdir_htab; /* Propdir lists */
2184  NHSHTAB qpid_htab; /* Queue process IDs */
2185  NHSHTAB redir_htab; /* Redirections */
2186  NHSHTAB objstack_htab; /* Object stacks */
2187  NHSHTAB objgrid_htab; /* Object grids */
2188  NHSHTAB parent_htab; /* Parent $-command exclusion */
2189  HASHTAB vars_htab; /* Persistent variables hashtable */
2190  HASHTAB structs_htab; /* Structure hashtable */
2191  HASHTAB cdefs_htab; /* Components hashtable */
2192  HASHTAB instance_htab; /* Instances hashtable */
2193  HASHTAB instdata_htab; /* Structure data hashtable */
2194  HASHTAB api_func_htab; /* Registered module API functions */
2195  MODULE *modules_list; /* Loadable modules hashtable */
2196  int max_structs;
2197  int max_cdefs;
2198  int max_instance;
2199  int max_instdata;
2200  int max_stacks;
2201  int max_vars;
2202  int attr_next; /* Next attr to alloc when freelist is empty */
2203  BQUE *qfirst; /* Head of player queue */
2204  BQUE *qlast; /* Tail of player queue */
2205  BQUE *qlfirst; /* Head of object queue */
2206  BQUE *qllast; /* Tail of object queue */
2207  BQUE *qwait; /* Head of wait queue */
2208  BQUE *qsemfirst; /* Head of semaphore queue */
2209  BQUE *qsemlast; /* Tail of semaphore queue */
2210  BADNAME *badname_head; /* List of disallowed names */
2211  int mstat_ixrss[2]; /* Summed shared size */
2212  int mstat_idrss[2]; /* Summed private data size */
2213  int mstat_isrss[2]; /* Summed private stack size */
2214  int mstat_secs[2]; /* Time of samples */
2215  int mstat_curr; /* Which sample is latest */
2216  ALIST iter_alist; /* Attribute list for iterations */
2217  char *mod_alist; /* Attribute list for modifying */
2218  int mod_size; /* Length of modified buffer */
2219  dbref mod_al_id; /* Where did mod_alist come from? */
2220  OLSTK *olist; /* Stack of object lists for nested searches */
2221  dbref freelist; /* Head of object freelist */
2222  int min_size; /* Minimum db size (from file header) */
2223  int db_top; /* Number of items in the db */
2224  int db_size; /* Allocated size of db structure */
2225  unsigned int moduletype_top; /* Highest module DBTYPE */
2226  int *guest_free; /* Table to keep track of free guests */
2227  MARKBUF *markbits; /* temp storage for marking/unmarking */
2228  int in_loop; /* In a loop() statement? */
2229  char *loop_token[MAX_ITER_NESTING]; /* Value of ## */
2230  char *loop_token2[MAX_ITER_NESTING]; /* Value of #? */
2231  int loop_number[MAX_ITER_NESTING]; /* Value of #@ */
2232  int loop_break[MAX_ITER_NESTING]; /* Kill this iter() loop? */
2233  int in_switch; /* In a switch() statement? */
2234  char *switch_token; /* Value of #$ */
2235  int func_nest_lev; /* Current nesting of functions */
2236  int func_invk_ctr; /* Functions invoked so far by this command */
2237  int ntfy_nest_lev; /* Current nesting of notifys */
2238  int lock_nest_lev; /* Current nesting of lock evals */
2239  int cmd_nest_lev; /* Current nesting of commands like @sw/now */
2240  int cmd_invk_ctr; /* Commands invoked so far by this qentry */
2241  int wild_times_lev; /* Wildcard matching tries. */
2242  GDATA *rdata; /* Global register data */
2243  int zone_nest_num; /* Global current zone nest position */
2244  int break_called; /* Boolean flag for @break and @assert */
2245  int f_limitmask; /* Flagword for limiter for functions */
2246  int inpipe; /* Boolean flag for command piping */
2247  char *pout; /* The output of the pipe used in %| */
2248  char *poutnew; /* The output being build by the current command */
2249  char *poutbufc; /* Buffer position for poutnew */
2250  dbref poutobj; /* Object doing the piping */
2251  clock_t cputime_base; /* CPU baselined at beginning of command */
2252  clock_t cputime_now; /* CPU time recorded during command */
2253  const unsigned char *retabs; /* PCRE regexp tables */
2254  MEMTRACK *raw_allocs; /* Tracking of raw memory allocations */
2255  int dbm_fd; /* File descriptor of our DBM database */
2256 };
2257 
2258 extern STATEDATA mudstate;
2259 
2260 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2261  * Misc. constants.
2262  */
2263 
2264 /* Global flags */
2265 
2266 /* Game control flags in mudconf.control_flags */
2267 
2268 #define CF_LOGIN 0x0001 /* Allow nonwiz logins to the MUSH */
2269 #define CF_BUILD 0x0002 /* Allow building commands */
2270 #define CF_INTERP 0x0004 /* Allow object triggering */
2271 #define CF_CHECKPOINT 0x0008 /* Perform auto-checkpointing */
2272 #define CF_DBCHECK 0x0010 /* Periodically check/clean the DB */
2273 #define CF_IDLECHECK 0x0020 /* Periodically check for idle users */
2274 /* empty 0x0040 */
2275 /* empty 0x0080 */
2276 #define CF_DEQUEUE 0x0100 /* Remove entries from the queue */
2277 #define CF_GODMONITOR 0x0200 /* Display commands to the God. */
2278 #define CF_EVENTCHECK 0x0400 /* Allow events checking */
2279 /* Host information codes */
2280 
2281 #define H_REGISTRATION 0x0001 /* Registration ALWAYS on */
2282 #define H_FORBIDDEN 0x0002 /* Reject all connects */
2283 #define H_SUSPECT 0x0004 /* Notify wizards of connects/disconnects */
2284 #define H_GUEST 0x0008 /* Don't permit guests from here */
2285 
2286 /* Logging options */
2287 
2288 #define LOG_ALLCOMMANDS 0x00000001 /* Log all commands */
2289 #define LOG_ACCOUNTING 0x00000002 /* Write accounting info on logout */
2290 #define LOG_BADCOMMANDS 0x00000004 /* Log bad commands */
2291 #define LOG_BUGS 0x00000008 /* Log program bugs found */
2292 #define LOG_DBSAVES 0x00000010 /* Log database dumps */
2293 #define LOG_CONFIGMODS 0x00000020 /* Log changes to configuration */
2294 #define LOG_PCREATES 0x00000040 /* Log character creations */
2295 #define LOG_KILLS 0x00000080 /* Log KILLs */
2296 #define LOG_LOGIN 0x00000100 /* Log logins and logouts */
2297 #define LOG_NET 0x00000200 /* Log net connects and disconnects */
2298 #define LOG_SECURITY 0x00000400 /* Log security-related events */
2299 #define LOG_SHOUTS 0x00000800 /* Log shouts */
2300 #define LOG_STARTUP 0x00001000 /* Log nonfatal errors in startup */
2301 #define LOG_WIZARD 0x00002000 /* Log dangerous things */
2302 #define LOG_ALLOCATE 0x00004000 /* Log alloc/free from buffer pools */
2303 #define LOG_PROBLEMS 0x00008000 /* Log runtime problems */
2304 #define LOG_KBCOMMANDS 0x00010000 /* Log keyboard commands */
2305 #define LOG_SUSPECTCMDS 0x00020000 /* Log SUSPECT player keyboard cmds */
2306 #define LOG_TIMEUSE 0x00040000 /* Log CPU time usage */
2307 #define LOG_LOCAL 0x00080000 /* Log user stuff via @log */
2308 #define LOG_MALLOC 0x00100000 /* Log malloc requests */
2309 #define LOG_FORCE 0x04000000 /* Ignore mudstate.logging */
2310 #define LOG_ALWAYS 0x80000000 /* Always log it */
2311 
2312 #define LOGOPT_FLAGS 0x01 /* Report flags on object */
2313 #define LOGOPT_LOC 0x02 /* Report loc of obj when requested */
2314 #define LOGOPT_OWNER 0x04 /* Report owner of obj if not obj */
2315 #define LOGOPT_TIMESTAMP 0x08 /* Timestamp log entries */
2316 
2317 #endif /* __MUDCONF_H */
2318 
2319 
2320 /*
2321  * From functions.h
2322  */
2323 
2324 #ifndef __FUNCTIONS_H
2325 #define __FUNCTIONS_H
2326 
2327 /*
2328  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2329  * Type definitions.
2330  */
2331 
2332 #define MAX_NFARGS 30
2333 
2334 typedef struct fun
2335 {
2336  const char *name; /* Function name */
2337  void (*fun)(); /* Handler */
2338  int nargs; /* Number of args needed or expected */
2339  unsigned int flags; /* Function flags */
2340  int perms; /* Access to function */
2341  EXTFUNCS *xperms; /* Extended access to function */
2342 } FUN;
2343 
2344 typedef struct ufun
2345 {
2346  char *name; /* Function name */
2347  dbref obj; /* Object ID */
2348  int atr; /* Attribute ID */
2349  unsigned int flags; /* Function flags */
2350  int perms; /* Access to function */
2351  struct ufun *next; /* Next ufun in chain */
2352 } UFUN;
2353 
2354 typedef struct delim
2355 {
2356  size_t len;
2357  char str[MAX_DELIM_LEN];
2358 } Delim;
2359 
2360 typedef struct var_entry VARENT;
2361 struct var_entry
2362 {
2363  char *text; /* variable text */
2364 };
2365 
2366 typedef struct component_def COMPONENT;
2367 struct component_def
2368 {
2369  int (*typer_func)(); /* type-checking handler */
2370  char *def_val; /* default value */
2371 };
2372 
2373 typedef struct structure_def STRUCTDEF;
2374 struct structure_def
2375 {
2376  char *s_name; /* name of the structure */
2377  char **c_names; /* array of component names */
2378  COMPONENT **c_array; /* array of pointers to components */
2379  int c_count; /* number of components */
2380  char delim; /* output delimiter when unloading */
2381  int need_typecheck; /* any components without types of
2382  * any? */
2383  int n_instances; /* number of instances out there */
2384  char *names_base; /* pointer for later freeing */
2385  char *defs_base; /* pointer for later freeing */
2386 };
2387 
2388 typedef struct instance_def INSTANCE;
2389 struct instance_def
2390 {
2391  STRUCTDEF *datatype; /* pointer to structure data type def */
2392 };
2393 
2394 typedef struct data_def STRUCTDATA;
2395 struct data_def
2396 {
2397  char *text;
2398 };
2399 
2400 typedef struct object_stack OBJSTACK;
2401 struct object_stack
2402 {
2403  char *data;
2404  OBJSTACK *next;
2405 };
2406 
2407 typedef struct object_grid OBJGRID;
2408 struct object_grid
2409 {
2410  int rows;
2411  int cols;
2412  char ***data;
2413 };
2414 
2415 typedef struct object_xfuncs OBJXFUNCS;
2416 struct object_xfuncs
2417 {
2418  NAMEDFUNC **func;
2419  int count;
2420 };
2421 
2422 /*
2423  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2424  * Constants used in delimiter macros.
2425  */
2426 
2427 #define DELIM_EVAL 0x001 /* Must eval delimiter. */
2428 #define DELIM_NULL 0x002 /* Null delimiter okay. */
2429 #define DELIM_CRLF 0x004 /* '%r' delimiter okay. */
2430 #define DELIM_STRING 0x008 /* Multi-character delimiter okay. */
2431 
2432 /*
2433  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2434  * Function declarations.
2435  */
2436 
2437 extern const Delim SPACE_DELIM;
2438 extern OBJXFUNCS xfunctions;
2439 
2440 #define FUNCTION(x) \
2441  void x(buff, bufc, player, caller, cause, fargs, nfargs, cargs, ncargs) char *buff, **bufc; \
2442  dbref player, caller, cause; \
2443  char *fargs[], *cargs[]; \
2444  int nfargs, ncargs;
2445 
2446 /*
2447  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2448  * Delimiter macros for functions that take an optional delimiter character.
2449  */
2450 
2451 /*
2452  * Minimum work needed to copy a delimiter. Assumes that the "str" member of
2453  * the Delim struct is last.
2454  */
2455 #define Delim_Copy(sep_dest, sep_src) \
2456  memcpy((sep_dest), (sep_src), \
2457  sizeof(Delim) - MAX_DELIM_LEN + 1 + (sep_src)->len)
2458 
2459 /*
2460  * Separator checking "helper" macros. VaChk_Sep(sep_ptr, sep_len, arg_n,
2461  * flags): Use arg_n as separator. VaChk_InSep(arg_number, flags): Use
2462  * arg_number as input sep. VaChk_DefaultOut(arg_number): If nfargs less than
2463  * arg_number, use the input separator. DO NOT PUT A SEMI-COLON AFTER THIS
2464  * MACRO. VaChk_OutSep(arg_number, flags): Use arg_number as output sep.
2465  */
2466 
2467 #define VaChk_Sep(xsep, xargnum, xflags) \
2468  if (!delim_check(buff, bufc, player, caller, cause, fargs, nfargs, cargs, ncargs, xargnum, xsep, xflags)) \
2469  return
2470 
2471 #define VaChk_InSep(xargnum, xflags) \
2472  VaChk_Sep(&isep, xargnum, (xflags) | DELIM_STRING)
2473 
2474 #define VaChk_DefaultOut(xargnum) \
2475  if (nfargs < xargnum) \
2476  { \
2477  Delim_Copy(&osep, &isep); \
2478  } \
2479  else
2480 
2481 #define VaChk_OutSep(xargnum, xflags) \
2482  VaChk_Sep(&osep, xargnum, (xflags) | DELIM_STRING | DELIM_NULL | DELIM_CRLF)
2483 
2484 #define VaChk_SepIn(xsep, xargnum, xflags) \
2485  VaChk_Sep(&(xsep), xargnum, (xflags) | DELIM_STRING)
2486 
2487 #define VaChk_SepOut(xsep, xargnum, xflags) \
2488  VaChk_Sep(&(xsep), xargnum, (xflags) | DELIM_STRING | DELIM_NULL | DELIM_CRLF)
2489 
2490 /*
2491  * VaChk_Range(min_args, max_args): Functions which take between min_args and
2492  * max_args. Don't check for delimiters.
2493  *
2494  * VaChk_Only_InPure(max_args): Functions which take max_args - 1 args or, with
2495  * a delimiter, max_args args. No special stuff.
2496  *
2497  * VaChk_Only_In(max_args): Functions which take max_args - 1 args or, with a
2498  * delimiter, max_args args.
2499  *
2500  * VaChk_Only_Out(max_args): Functions which take max_args - 1 args or, with a
2501  * delimiter, max_args args. The one delimiter is an output delim.
2502  *
2503  * VaChk_InPure(max_args): Functions which take max_args - 1 args or, with a
2504  * delimiter, max_args args. No special stuff.
2505  *
2506  * VaChk_In(min_args, max_args): Functions which take between min_args and
2507  * max_args, with max_args as a delimiter.
2508  *
2509  * VaChk_Out(min_args, max_args): Functions which take between min_args and
2510  * max_args, with max_args as an output delimiter.
2511  *
2512  * VaChk_Only_In_Out(max_args): Functions which take at least max_args - 2, with
2513  * max_args - 1 as an input delimiter, and max_args as an output delimiter.
2514  *
2515  * VaChk_In_Out(min_args, max_args): Functions which take at least min_args,
2516  * with max_args - 1 as an input delimiter, and max_args as an output
2517  * delimiter.
2518  *
2519  * VaChk_InEval_OutEval(min_args, max_args): Functions which take at least
2520  * min_args, with max_args - 1 as an input delimiter that must be evaluated,
2521  * and max_args as an output delimiter which must be evaluated.
2522  */
2523 
2524 #define VaChk_Range(xminargs, xnargs) \
2525  if (!fn_range_check(((FUN *)fargs[-1])->name, nfargs, xminargs, xnargs, buff, bufc)) \
2526  return
2527 
2528 #define VaChk_Only_InPure(xnargs) \
2529  VaChk_Range(xnargs - 1, xnargs); \
2530  if (!delim_check(buff, bufc, player, caller, cause, fargs, nfargs, cargs, ncargs, xnargs, &isep, 0)) \
2531  return
2532 
2533 #define VaChk_Only_In(xnargs) \
2534  VaChk_Range(xnargs - 1, xnargs); \
2535  VaChk_InSep(xnargs, 0)
2536 
2537 #define VaChk_Only_Out(xnargs) \
2538  VaChk_Range(xnargs - 1, xnargs); \
2539  VaChk_OutSep(xnargs, 0)
2540 
2541 #define VaChk_InPure(xminargs, xnargs) \
2542  VaChk_Range(xminargs, xnargs); \
2543  if (!delim_check(buff, bufc, player, caller, cause, fargs, nfargs, cargs, ncargs, xnargs, &isep, 0)) \
2544  return
2545 
2546 #define VaChk_In(xminargs, xnargs) \
2547  VaChk_Range(xminargs, xnargs); \
2548  VaChk_InSep(xnargs, 0)
2549 
2550 #define VaChk_Out(xminargs, xnargs) \
2551  VaChk_Range(xminargs, xnargs); \
2552  VaChk_OutSep(xnargs, 0)
2553 
2554 #define VaChk_Only_In_Out(xnargs) \
2555  VaChk_Range(xnargs - 2, xnargs); \
2556  VaChk_InSep(xnargs - 1, 0); \
2557  VaChk_DefaultOut(xnargs) \
2558  { \
2559  VaChk_OutSep(xnargs, 0); \
2560  }
2561 
2562 #define VaChk_In_Out(xminargs, xnargs) \
2563  VaChk_Range(xminargs, xnargs); \
2564  VaChk_InSep(xnargs - 1, 0); \
2565  VaChk_DefaultOut(xnargs) \
2566  { \
2567  VaChk_OutSep(xnargs, 0); \
2568  }
2569 
2570 #define VaChk_InEval_OutEval(xminargs, xnargs) \
2571  VaChk_Range(xminargs, xnargs); \
2572  VaChk_InSep(xnargs - 1, DELIM_EVAL); \
2573  VaChk_OutSep(xnargs, DELIM_EVAL)
2574 
2575 #define VaChk_Only_InEval(xnargs) \
2576  VaChk_Range(xnargs - 1, xnargs); \
2577  VaChk_InSep(xnargs, DELIM_EVAL)
2578 
2579 /*
2580  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2581  * Miscellaneous macros.
2582  */
2583 
2584 /*
2585  * Get function flags. Note that Is_Func() and Func_Mask() are identical;
2586  * they are given specific names for code clarity.
2587  */
2588 
2589 #define Func_Flags(x) (((FUN *)(x)[-1])->flags)
2590 #define Is_Func(x) (((FUN *)fargs[-1])->flags & (x))
2591 #define Func_Mask(x) (((FUN *)fargs[-1])->flags & (x))
2592 
2593 /* Check access to built-in function. */
2594 
2595 #define Check_Func_Access(p, f) \
2596  (check_access(p, (f)->perms) && \
2597  (!((f)->xperms) || check_mod_access(p, (f)->xperms)))
2598 
2599 /* Trim spaces. */
2600 
2601 #define Eat_Spaces(x) trim_space_sep((x), &SPACE_DELIM)
2602 
2603 /* Special handling of separators. */
2604 
2605 #define print_sep(s, b, p) \
2606  if ((s)->len == 1) \
2607  { \
2608  if ((s)->str[0] == '\r') \
2609  { \
2610  SAFE_CRLF((b), (p)); \
2611  } \
2612  else if ((s)->str[0] != '\0') \
2613  { \
2614  SAFE_LB_CHR((s)->str[0], (b), (p)); \
2615  } \
2616  } \
2617  else \
2618  { \
2619  SAFE_STRNCAT((b), (p), (s)->str, (s)->len, LBUF_SIZE); \
2620  }
2621 
2622 /*
2623  * Macro for finding an <attr> or <obj>/<attr> Parse_Uattr(player, string to
2624  * parse, thing, attribute number, attr pointer)
2625  */
2626 
2627 #define Parse_Uattr(p, s, t, n, a) \
2628  if (parse_attrib((p), (s), &(t), &(n), 0)) \
2629  { \
2630  if (((n) == NOTHING) || !(Good_obj(t))) \
2631  (a) = NULL; \
2632  else \
2633  (a) = atr_num(n); \
2634  } \
2635  else \
2636  { \
2637  (t) = (p); \
2638  (a) = atr_str(s); \
2639  }
2640 
2641 /*
2642  * Macro for obtaining an attrib Get_Uattr(player, thing, attr pointer, text
2643  * buffer, owner, flags, length)
2644  */
2645 
2646 #define Get_Uattr(p, t, a, b, o, f, l) \
2647  if (!(a)) \
2648  { \
2649  return; \
2650  } \
2651  (b) = atr_pget((t), (a)->number, &(o), &(f), &(l)); \
2652  if (!*(b) || !(See_attr((p), (t), (a), (o), (f)))) \
2653  { \
2654  XFREE(b); \
2655  return; \
2656  }
2657 
2658 /*
2659  * Macro for getting an <attr>, <obj>/<attr> or #lambda/<code>
2660  * Get_Ulambda(player, thing, string, anum, ap, atext, aowner, aflags, alen)
2661  */
2662 
2663 #define Get_Ulambda(p, t, s, n, a, b, o, f, l) \
2664  if (string_prefix((s), "#lambda/")) \
2665  { \
2666  (t) = (p); \
2667  (n) = NOTHING; \
2668  (a) = NULL; \
2669  (b) = XMALLOC(LBUF_SIZE, "lambda.atext"); \
2670  (l) = strlen((s) + 8); \
2671  StrCopyKnown((b), (s) + 8, (l)); \
2672  (o) = (p); \
2673  (f) = 0; \
2674  } \
2675  else \
2676  { \
2677  Parse_Uattr((p), (s), (t), (n), (a)); \
2678  Get_Uattr((p), (t), (a), (b), (o), (f), (l)); \
2679  }
2680 
2681 /*
2682  * Macro for writing a certain amount of padding into a buffer. l is the
2683  * number of characters left to write. m is a throwaway integer for holding
2684  * the maximum. c is the separator character to use.
2685  */
2686 #define print_padding(l, m, c) \
2687  if ((l) > 0) \
2688  { \
2689  (m) = LBUF_SIZE - 1 - (*bufc - buff); \
2690  (l) = ((l) > (m)) ? (m) : (l); \
2691  XMEMSET(*bufc, (c), (l)); \
2692  *bufc += (l); \
2693  **bufc = '\0'; \
2694  }
2695 
2696 /* Handling CPU time checking. */
2697 
2698 /*
2699  * CPU time "clock()" compatibility notes:
2700  *
2701  * Linux clock() doesn't necessarily start at 0. BSD clock() does appear to
2702  * always start at 0.
2703  *
2704  * Linux sets CLOCKS_PER_SEC to 1000000, citing POSIX, so its clock() will wrap
2705  * around from (32-bit) INT_MAX to INT_MIN every 72 cpu-minutes or so. The
2706  * actual clock resolution is low enough that, for example, it probably never
2707  * returns odd numbers.
2708  *
2709  * BSD sets CLOCKS_PER_SEC to 100, so theoretically I could hose a cpu for 250
2710  * days and see what it does when it hits INT_MAX. Any bets? Any possible
2711  * reason to care?
2712  *
2713  * NetBSD clock() can occasionally decrease as the scheduler's estimate of how
2714  * much cpu the mush will use during the current timeslice is revised, so we
2715  * can't use subtraction.
2716  *
2717  * BSD clock() returns -1 if there is an error.
2718  */
2719 
2720 /*
2721  * CPU time logic notes:
2722  *
2723  * B = mudstate.cputime_base L = mudstate.cputime_base + mudconf.func_cpu_lim N
2724  * = mudstate.cputime_now
2725  *
2726  * Assuming B != -1 and N != -1 to catch errors on BSD, the possible
2727  * combinations of these values are as follows (note >> means "much greater
2728  * than", not right shift):
2729  *
2730  * 1. B < L normal -- limit should be checked, and is not wrapped yet 2. B
2731  * == L disabled -- limit should not be checked 3. B > L strange --
2732  * probably misconfigured 4. B >> L wrapped -- limit should be checked, and
2733  * note L wrapped
2734  *
2735  * 1. normal: 1a. N << B -- too much, N wrapped 1b. N < B --
2736  * fine, NetBSD counted backwards 1c. N >= B, N <= L -- fine 1d. N > L
2737  * -- too much
2738  *
2739  * 2. disabled: 2a. always -- fine, not checking
2740  *
2741  * 3. strange: 3a. always -- fine, I guess we shouldn't check
2742  *
2743  * 4. wrapped: 4a. N <= L -- fine, N wrapped but not over limit yet
2744  * 4b. N > L, N << B -- too much, N wrapped 4c. N < B -- fine,
2745  * NetBSD counted backwards 4d. N >= B -- fine
2746  *
2747  * Note that 1a, 1d, and 4b are the cases where we can be certain that too much
2748  * cpu has been used. The code below only checks for 1d. The other two are
2749  * corner cases that require some distinction between "x > y" and "x >> y".
2750  */
2751 
2752 #define Too_Much_CPU() \
2753  ((mudstate.cputime_now = clock()), \
2754  ((mudstate.cputime_now > mudstate.cputime_base + mudconf.func_cpu_lim) && \
2755  (mudstate.cputime_base + mudconf.func_cpu_lim > mudstate.cputime_base) && \
2756  (mudstate.cputime_base != -1) && \
2757  (mudstate.cputime_now != -1)))
2758 
2759 /*
2760  * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2761  * Function-specific flags used in the function table.
2762  */
2763 
2764 /* from handle_sort (sort, isort): */
2765 #define SORT_OPER 0x0f /* mask to select sort operation bits */
2766 #define SORT_ITEMS 0
2767 #define SORT_POS 1
2768 
2769 /* from handle_sets (setunion, setdiff, setinter, lunion, ldiff, linter): */
2770 #define SET_OPER 0x0f /* mask to select set operation bits */
2771 #define SET_UNION 0
2772 #define SET_INTERSECT 1
2773 #define SET_DIFF 2
2774 #define SET_TYPE 0x10 /* set type is given, don't autodetect */
2775 
2776 /* from process_tables (tables, rtables, ctables): */
2777 /* from perform_border (border, rborder, cborder): */
2778 /* from perform_align (align, lalign): */
2779 #define JUST_TYPE 0x0f /* mask to select justification bits */
2780 #define JUST_LEFT 0x01
2781 #define JUST_RIGHT 0x02
2782 #define JUST_CENTER 0x04
2783 #define JUST_REPEAT 0x10
2784 #define JUST_COALEFT 0x20
2785 #define JUST_COARIGHT 0x40
2786 
2787 /*
2788  * from handle_logic (and, or, andbool, orbool, land, lor, landbool, lorbool,
2789  * cand, cor, candbool, corbool, xor, xorbool):
2790  */
2791 /* from handle_flaglists (andflags, orflags): */
2792 /* from handle_filter (filter, filterbool): */
2793 #define LOGIC_OPER 0x0f /* mask to select boolean operation bits */
2794 #define LOGIC_AND 0
2795 #define LOGIC_OR 1
2796 #define LOGIC_XOR 2
2797 #define LOGIC_BOOL 0x10 /* interpret operands as boolean, not int */
2798 #define LOGIC_LIST 0x40 /* operands come in a list, not separately */
2799 
2800 /* from handle_vectors (vadd, vsub, vmul, vdot): */
2801 #define VEC_OPER 0x0f /* mask to select vector operation bits */
2802 #define VEC_ADD 0
2803 #define VEC_SUB 1
2804 #define VEC_MUL 2
2805 #define VEC_DOT 3
2806 /* #define VEC_CROSS 4 -- not implemented */
2807 #define VEC_OR 7
2808 #define VEC_AND 8
2809 #define VEC_XOR 9
2810 
2811 /* from handle_vector (vmag, vunit): */
2812 #define VEC_MAG 5
2813 #define VEC_UNIT 6
2814 
2815 /* from perform_loop (loop, parse): */
2816 /* from perform_iter (list, iter, whentrue, whenfalse, istrue, isfalse): */
2817 #define BOOL_COND_TYPE 0x0f /* mask to select exit-condition bits */
2818 #define BOOL_COND_NONE 1 /* loop until end of list */
2819 #define BOOL_COND_FALSE 2 /* loop until true */
2820 #define BOOL_COND_TRUE 3 /* loop until false */
2821 #define FILT_COND_TYPE 0x0f0 /* mask to select filter bits */
2822 #define FILT_COND_NONE 0x010 /* show all results */
2823 #define FILT_COND_FALSE 0x020 /* show only false results */
2824 #define FILT_COND_TRUE 0x030 /* show only true results */
2825 #define LOOP_NOTIFY 0x100 /* send loop results directly to enactor */
2826 #define LOOP_TWOLISTS 0x200 /* process two lists */
2827 
2828 /* from handle_okpres (hears, moves, knows): */
2829 #define PRESFN_OPER 0x0f /* Mask to select bits */
2830 #define PRESFN_HEARS 0x01 /* Detect hearing */
2831 #define PRESFN_MOVES 0x02 /* Detect movement */
2832 #define PRESFN_KNOWS 0x04 /* Detect knows */
2833 
2834 /* from perform_get (get, get_eval, xget, eval(a,b)): */
2835 #define GET_EVAL 0x01 /* evaluate the attribute */
2836 #define GET_XARGS 0x02 /* obj and attr are two separate args */
2837 
2838 /* from handle_pop (pop, peek, toss): */
2839 #define POP_PEEK 0x01 /* don't remove item from stack */
2840 #define POP_TOSS 0x02 /* don't display item from stack */
2841 
2842 /* from perform_regedit (regedit, regediti, regeditall, regeditalli): */
2843 /* from perform_regparse (regparse, regparsei): */
2844 /* from perform_regrab (regrab, regrabi, regraball, regraballi): */
2845 /* from perform_regmatch (regmatch, regmatchi): */
2846 /* from perform_grep (grep, grepi, wildgrep, regrep, regrepi): */
2847 #define REG_CASELESS 0x01 /* XXX must equal PCRE_CASELESS */
2848 #define REG_MATCH_ALL 0x02 /* operate on all matches in a list */
2849 #define REG_TYPE 0x0c /* mask to select grep type bits */
2850 #define GREP_EXACT 0
2851 #define GREP_WILD 4
2852 #define GREP_REGEXP 8
2853 
2854 /*
2855  * from handle_trig (sin, cos, tan, asin, acos, atan, sind, cosd, tand,
2856  * asind, acosd, atand):
2857  */
2858 #define TRIG_OPER 0x0f /* mask to select trig function bits */
2859 #define TRIG_CO 0x01 /* co-function, like cos as opposed to sin */
2860 #define TRIG_TAN 0x02 /* tan-function, like cot as opposed to cos */
2861 #define TRIG_ARC 0x04 /* arc-function, like asin as opposed to sin */
2862 /* #define TRIG_REC 0x08 -- reciprocal, like sec as opposed to sin */
2863 #define TRIG_DEG 0x10 /* angles are in degrees, not radians */
2864 
2865 /* from handle_pronoun (obj, poss, subj, aposs): */
2866 #define PRONOUN_OBJ 0
2867 #define PRONOUN_POSS 1
2868 #define PRONOUN_SUBJ 2
2869 #define PRONOUN_APOSS 3
2870 
2871 /* from do_ufun(): */
2872 #define U_LOCAL 0x01 /* ulocal: preserve global registers */
2873 #define U_PRIVATE 0x02 /* ulocal: preserve global registers */
2874 
2875 /* from handle_ifelse() and handle_if() */
2876 #define IFELSE_OPER 0x0f /* mask */
2877 #define IFELSE_BOOL 0x01 /* check for boolean (defaults to nonzero) */
2878 #define IFELSE_FALSE 0x02 /* order false,true instead of true,false */
2879 #define IFELSE_DEFAULT 0x04 /* only two args, use condition as output */
2880 #define IFELSE_TOKEN 0x08 /* allow switch-token substitution */
2881 
2882 /* from handle_timestamps() */
2883 #define TIMESTAMP_MOD 0x01 /* lastmod() */
2884 #define TIMESTAMP_ACC 0X02 /* lastaccess() */
2885 #define TIMESTAMP_CRE 0x04 /* creation() */
2886 
2887 /* Miscellaneous */
2888 #define LATTR_COUNT 0x01 /* nattr: just return attribute count */
2889 #define LOCFN_WHERE 0x01 /* loc: where() vs. loc() */
2890 #define NAMEFN_FULLNAME 0x01 /* name: fullname() vs. name() */
2891 #define CHECK_PARENTS 0x01 /* hasattrp: recurse up the parent chain */
2892 #define CONNINFO_IDLE 0x01 /* conninfo: idle() vs. conn() */
2893 #define UCALL_SANDBOX 0x01 /* ucall: sandbox() vs. ucall() */
2894 
2895 #endif /* __FUNCTIONS_H */
2896 
2897 
2898 /*
2899  * From powers.h
2900  */
2901 
2902 #ifndef __POWERS_H
2903 #define __POWERS_H
2904 
2905 #define POWER_EXT 0x1 /* Lives in extended powers word */
2906 
2907 /* First word of powers */
2908 #define POW_CHG_QUOTAS 0x00000001 /* May change and see quotas */
2909 #define POW_CHOWN_ANY 0x00000002 /* Can @chown anything or to anyone */
2910 #define POW_ANNOUNCE 0x00000004 /* May use @wall */
2911 #define POW_BOOT 0x00000008 /* May use @boot */
2912 #define POW_HALT 0x00000010 /* May @halt on other's objects */
2913 #define POW_CONTROL_ALL 0x00000020 /* I control everything */
2914 #define POW_WIZARD_WHO 0x00000040 /* See extra WHO information */
2915 #define POW_EXAM_ALL 0x00000080 /* I can examine everything */
2916 #define POW_FIND_UNFIND 0x00000100 /* Can find unfindable players */
2917 #define POW_FREE_MONEY 0x00000200 /* I have infinite money */
2918 #define POW_FREE_QUOTA 0x00000400 /* I have infinite quota */
2919 #define POW_HIDE 0x00000800 /* Can set themselves DARK */
2920 #define POW_IDLE 0x00001000 /* No idle limit */
2921 #define POW_SEARCH 0x00002000 /* Can @search anyone */
2922 #define POW_LONGFINGERS 0x00004000 /* Can get/whisper/etc from a distance */
2923 #define POW_PROG 0x00008000 /* Can use the @prog command */
2924 #define POW_MDARK_ATTR 0x00010000 /* Can read AF_MDARK attrs */
2925 #define POW_WIZ_ATTR 0x00020000 /* Can write AF_WIZARD attrs */
2926 
2927 /* FREE FREE FREE FREE */
2928 
2929 #define POW_COMM_ALL 0x00080000 /* Channel wiz */
2930 #define POW_SEE_QUEUE 0x00100000 /* Player can see the entire queue */
2931 #define POW_SEE_HIDDEN 0x00200000 /* Player can see hidden players on WHO list */
2932 #define POW_WATCH 0x00400000 /* Player can set or clear WATCHER */
2933 #define POW_POLL 0x00800000 /* Player can set the doing poll */
2934 #define POW_NO_DESTROY 0x01000000 /* Cannot be destroyed */
2935 #define POW_GUEST 0x02000000 /* Player is a guest */
2936 #define POW_PASS_LOCKS 0x04000000 /* Player can pass any lock */
2937 #define POW_STAT_ANY 0x08000000 /* Can @stat anyone */
2938 #define POW_STEAL 0x10000000 /* Can give negative money */
2939 #define POW_TEL_ANYWHR 0x20000000 /* Teleport anywhere */
2940 #define POW_TEL_UNRST 0x40000000 /* Teleport anything */
2941 #define POW_UNKILLABLE 0x80000000 /* Can't be killed */
2942 
2943 /* Second word of powers */
2944 #define POW_BUILDER 0x00000001 /* Can build */
2945 #define POW_LINKVAR 0x00000002 /* Can link an exit to "variable" */
2946 #define POW_LINKTOANY 0x00000004 /* Can link to any object */
2947 #define POW_OPENANYLOC 0x00000008 /* Can open from anywhere */
2948 #define POW_USE_MODULE 0x00000010 /* Can use MODULE queries directly */
2949 #define POW_LINKHOME 0x00000020 /* Can link object to any home */
2950 #define POW_CLOAK 0x00000040 /* Can vanish from sight via DARK */
2951 
2952 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
2953  * POWERENT: Information about object powers.
2954  */
2955 
2956 typedef struct power_entry
2957 {
2958  const char *powername; /* Name of the flag */
2959  int powervalue; /* Which bit in the object is the flag */
2960  int powerpower; /* Ctrl flags for this power (recursive? :-) */
2961  int listperm; /* Who sees this flag when set */
2962  int (*handler)(); /* Handler for setting/clearing this flag */
2963 } POWERENT;
2964 
2965 typedef struct powerset
2966 {
2967  POWER word1;
2968  POWER word2;
2969 } POWERSET;
2970 
2971 #define s_Change_Quotas(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_CHG_QUOTAS)
2972 #define s_Chown_Any(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_CHOWN_ANY)
2973 #define s_Announce(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_ANNOUNCE)
2974 #define s_Can_Boot(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_BOOT)
2975 #define s_Can_Halt(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_HALT)
2976 #define s_Control_All(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_CONTROL_ALL)
2977 #define s_Wizard_Who(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_WIZARD_WHO)
2978 #define s_See_All(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_EXAM_ALL)
2979 #define s_Find_Unfindable(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_FIND_UNFIND)
2980 #define s_Free_Money(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_FREE_MONEY)
2981 #define s_Free_Quota(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_FREE_QUOTA)
2982 #define s_Can_Hide(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_HIDE)
2983 #define s_Can_Idle(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_IDLE)
2984 #define s_Search(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_SEARCH)
2985 #define s_Long_Fingers(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_LONGFINGERS)
2986 #define s_Prog(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_PROG)
2987 #define s_Comm_All(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_COMM_ALL)
2988 #define s_See_Queue(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_SEE_QUEUE)
2989 #define s_See_Hidden(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_SEE_HIDDEN)
2990 #define s_Can_Watch(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_WATCH)
2991 #define s_Can_Poll(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_POLL)
2992 #define s_No_Destroy(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_NO_DESTROY)
2993 #define s_Guest(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_GUEST)
2994 #define s_Set_Maint_Flags(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_SET_MFLAGS)
2995 #define s_Stat_Any(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_STAT_ANY)
2996 #define s_Steal(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_STEAL)
2997 #define s_Tel_Anywhere(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_TEL_ANYWHR)
2998 #define s_Tel_Anything(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_TEL_UNRST)
2999 #define s_Unkillable(c) s_Powers((c), Powers(c) | POW_UNKILLABLE)
3000 #define s_Builder(c) s_Powers2((c), Powers2(c) | POW_BUILDER)
3001 
3002 #define Can_Set_Quota(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_CHG_QUOTAS) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3003 #define Chown_Any(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_CHOWN_ANY) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3004 #define Announce(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_ANNOUNCE) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3005 #define Can_Boot(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_BOOT) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3006 #define Can_Halt(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_HALT) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3007 #define Control_All(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_CONTROL_ALL) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3008 #define Wizard_Who(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_WIZARD_WHO) != 0) || WizRoy(c))
3009 #define See_All(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_EXAM_ALL) != 0) || WizRoy(c))
3010 #define Find_Unfindable(c) ((Powers(c) & POW_FIND_UNFIND) != 0)
3011 #define Free_Money(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_FREE_MONEY) != 0) || Immortal(c))
3012 #define Free_Quota(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_FREE_QUOTA) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3013 #define Can_Hide(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_HIDE) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3014 #define Can_Idle(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_IDLE) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3015 #define Search(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_SEARCH) != 0) || WizRoy(c))
3016 #define Long_Fingers(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_LONGFINGERS) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3017 #define Comm_All(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_COMM_ALL) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3018 #define See_Queue(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_SEE_QUEUE) != 0) || WizRoy(c))
3019 #define See_Hidden(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_SEE_HIDDEN) != 0) || WizRoy(c))
3020 #define Can_Watch(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_WATCH) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3021 #define Can_Poll(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_POLL) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3022 #define No_Destroy(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_NO_DESTROY) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3023 #define Guest(c) ((Powers(c) & POW_GUEST) != 0)
3024 #define Set_Maint_Flags(c) ((Powers(c) & POW_SET_MFLAGS) != 0)
3025 #define Stat_Any(c) ((Powers(c) & POW_STAT_ANY) != 0)
3026 #define Steal(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_STEAL) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3027 #define Tel_Anywhere(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_TEL_ANYWHR) != 0) || Tel_Anything(c))
3028 #define Tel_Anything(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_TEL_UNRST) != 0) || WizRoy(c))
3029 #define Unkillable(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_UNKILLABLE) != 0) || Immortal(c))
3030 #define Prog(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_PROG) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3031 #define Sees_Hidden_Attrs(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_MDARK_ATTR) != 0) || WizRoy(c))
3032 #define Sets_Wiz_Attrs(c) (((Powers(c) & POW_WIZ_ATTR) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3033 #define Pass_Locks(c) ((Powers(c) & POW_PASS_LOCKS) != 0)
3034 #define Builder(c) (((Powers2(c) & POW_BUILDER) != 0) || WizRoy(c))
3035 #define LinkVariable(c) (((Powers2(c) & POW_LINKVAR) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3036 #define LinkToAny(c) (((Powers2(c) & POW_LINKTOANY) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3037 #define LinkAnyHome(c) (((Powers2(c) & POW_LINKHOME) != 0) || Wizard(c))
3038 #define Open_Anywhere(c) ((Powers2(c) & POW_OPENANYLOC) != 0)
3039 #define Can_Cloak(c) ((Powers2(c) & POW_CLOAK) != 0)
3040 #define Can_Use_Module(c) ((Powers2(c) & POW_USE_MODULE) != 0)
3041 
3042 #endif /* __POWERS_H */

3048 
3049 #ifndef __ATTRS_H
3050 #define __ATTRS_H
3051 
3056 #define AF_ODARK 0x00000001
3057 #define AF_DARK 0x00000002
3058 #define AF_WIZARD 0x00000004
3059 #define AF_MDARK 0x00000008
3060 #define AF_INTERNAL 0x00000010
3061 #define AF_NOCMD 0x00000020
3062 #define AF_LOCK 0x00000040
3063 #define AF_DELETED 0x00000080
3064 #define AF_NOPROG 0x00000100
3065 #define AF_GOD 0x00000200
3066 #define AF_IS_LOCK 0x00000400
3067 #define AF_VISUAL 0x00000800
3068 #define AF_PRIVATE 0x00001000
3069 #define AF_HTML 0x00002000
3070 #define AF_NOPARSE 0x00004000
3071 #define AF_REGEXP 0x00008000
3072 #define AF_NOCLONE 0x00010000
3073 #define AF_CONST 0x00020000
3074 #define AF_CASE 0x00040000
3075 #define AF_STRUCTURE 0x00080000
3076 #define AF_DIRTY 0x00100000
3077 #define AF_DEFAULT 0x00200000
3078 #define AF_NONAME 0x00400000
3079 #define AF_RMATCH 0x00800000
3080 #define AF_NOW 0x01000000
3081 #define AF_TRACE 0x02000000
3082 #define AF_FREE_1 0x04000000
3083 #define AF_FREE_2 0x08000000
3084 #define AF_FREE_3 0x10000000
3085 #define AF_FREE_4 0x20000000
3086 #define AF_FREE_5 0x40000000
3087 #define AF_FREE_6 0x80000000
3093 #define A_NULL 0
3094 #define A_OSUCC 1
3095 #define A_OFAIL 2
3096 #define A_FAIL 3
3097 #define A_SUCC 4
3098 #define A_PASS 5

3102 #define A_DROP 9

3104 #define A_KILL 11

3106 #define A_AFAIL 13

3108 #define A_AKILL 15

3121 #define A_AMHEAR 28

3357 #define Print_Attr_Flags(a, b, p) \
3358  p = b; \
3359  if (a & AF_LOCK) \
3360  *p++ = '+'; \
3361  if (a & AF_NOPROG) \
3362  *p++ = '$'; \
3363  if (a & AF_CASE) \
3364  *p++ = 'C'; \
3365  if (a & AF_DEFAULT) \
3366  *p++ = 'D'; \
3367  if (a & AF_HTML) \
3368  *p++ = 'H'; \
3369  if (a & AF_PRIVATE) \
3370  *p++ = 'I'; \
3371  if (a & AF_RMATCH) \
3372  *p++ = 'M'; \
3373  if (a & AF_NONAME) \
3374  *p++ = 'N'; \
3375  if (a & AF_NOPARSE) \
3376  *p++ = 'P'; \
3377  if (a & AF_NOW) \
3378  *p++ = 'Q'; \
3379  if (a & AF_REGEXP) \
3380  *p++ = 'R'; \
3381  if (a & AF_STRUCTURE) \
3382  *p++ = 'S'; \
3383  if (a & AF_TRACE) \
3384  *p++ = 'T'; \
3385  if (a & AF_VISUAL) \
3386  *p++ = 'V'; \
3387  if (a & AF_NOCLONE) \
3388  *p++ = 'c'; \
3389  if (a & AF_DARK) \
3390  *p++ = 'd'; \
3391  if (a & AF_GOD) \
3392  *p++ = 'g'; \
3393  if (a & AF_CONST) \
3394  *p++ = 'k'; \
3395  if (a & AF_MDARK) \
3396  *p++ = 'm'; \
3397  if (a & AF_WIZARD) \
3398  *p++ = 'w'; \
3399  *p = '\0';
3400 
3401 #endif /* __ATTRS_H */
3402 
3403 
3404 /*
3405  * From match.h
3406  */
3407 
3408 #ifndef __MATCH_H
3409 #define __MATCH_H
3410 
3411 typedef struct match_state MSTATE;
3412 struct match_state
3413 {
3414  int confidence; /* How confident are we? CON_xx */
3415  int count; /* # of matches at this confidence */
3416  int pref_type; /* The preferred object type */
3417  int check_keys; /* Should we test locks? */
3418  dbref absolute_form; /* If #num, then the number */
3419  dbref match; /* What I've found so far */
3420  dbref player; /* Who is performing match */
3421  char *string; /* The string to search for */
3422 };
3423 
3424 /* Match functions
3425  * Usage:
3426  * init_match(player, name, type);
3427  * match_this();
3428  * match_that();
3429  * ...
3430  * thing = match_result()
3431  */
3432 
3433 #define NOMATCH_MESSAGE "I don't see that here."
3434 #define AMBIGUOUS_MESSAGE "I don't know which one you mean!"
3435 #define NOPERM_MESSAGE "Permission denied."
3436 
3437 #define MAT_NO_EXITS 1 /* Don't check for exits */
3438 #define MAT_EXIT_PARENTS 2 /* Check for exits in parents */
3439 #define MAT_NUMERIC 4 /* Check for un-#ified dbrefs */
3440 #define MAT_HOME 8 /* Check for 'home' */
3441 
3442 #endif /* __MATCH_H */
3443

3446  * From command.h
3447  */
3448 
3449 #ifndef __COMMAND_H
3450 #define __COMMAND_H
3451 
3452 typedef struct addedentry ADDENT;
3453 struct addedentry
3454 {
3455  dbref thing;
3456  int atr;
3457  char *name;
3458  struct addedentry *next;
3459 };
3460 
3461 typedef struct cmdentry CMDENT;
3462 struct cmdentry
3463 {
3464  char *cmdname;
3465  NAMETAB *switches;
3466  int perms;
3467  int extra;
3468  int callseq;
3469  HOOKENT *userperms;
3470  HOOKENT *pre_hook;
3471  HOOKENT *post_hook;
3472  union
3473  {
3474  void (*handler)();
3475  ADDENT *added;
3476  } info;
3477 };
3478 
3479 /* Command handler call conventions */
3480 
3481 #define CS_NO_ARGS 0x00000
3482 #define CS_ONE_ARG 0x00001
3483 #define CS_TWO_ARG 0x00002
3484 #define CS_NARG_MASK 0x00003
3485 #define CS_ARGV 0x00004
3486 #define CS_INTERP 0x00010
3487 #define CS_NOINTERP 0x00020
3488 #define CS_CAUSE 0x00040
3489 #define CS_UNPARSE 0x00080
3490 #define CS_CMDARG 0x00100
3491 #define CS_STRIP 0x00200
3492 #define CS_STRIP_AROUND 0x00400
3493 #define CS_ADDED 0x00800
3494 #define CS_LEADIN 0x01000
3495 #define CS_PRESERVE 0x02000
3496 #define CS_NOSQUISH 0x04000
3497 #define CS_FUNCTION 0x08000
3498 #define CS_ACTOR 0x10000
3499 #define CS_PRIVATE 0x20000
3501 /* Command permission flags */
3502 
3503 #define CA_PUBLIC 0x00000000
3504 #define CA_GOD 0x00000001
3505 #define CA_WIZARD 0x00000002
3506 #define CA_BUILDER 0x00000004
3507 #define CA_IMMORTAL 0x00000008
3508 #define CA_STAFF 0x00000010
3509 #define CA_HEAD 0x00000020
3510 #define CA_MODULE_OK 0x00000040
3511 #define CA_ADMIN 0x00000080
3513 #define CA_ISPRIV_MASK (CA_GOD | CA_WIZARD | CA_BUILDER | CA_IMMORTAL | CA_STAFF | CA_HEAD | CA_ADMIN | CA_MODULE_OK)
3514 
3515 #define CA_NO_HAVEN 0x00000100
3516 #define CA_NO_ROBOT 0x00000200
3517 #define CA_NO_SLAVE 0x00000400
3518 #define CA_NO_SUSPECT 0x00000800
3519 #define CA_NO_GUEST 0x00001000
3521 #define CA_ISNOT_MASK (CA_NO_HAVEN | CA_NO_ROBOT | CA_NO_SLAVE | CA_NO_SUSPECT | CA_NO_GUEST)
3522 
3523 #define CA_MARKER0 0x00002000
3524 #define CA_MARKER1 0x00004000
3525 #define CA_MARKER2 0x00008000
3526 #define CA_MARKER3 0x00010000
3527 #define CA_MARKER4 0x00020000
3528 #define CA_MARKER5 0x00040000
3529 #define CA_MARKER6 0x00080000
3530 #define CA_MARKER7 0x00100000
3531 #define CA_MARKER8 0x00200000
3532 #define CA_MARKER9 0x00400000
3533 
3534 #define CA_MARKER_MASK (CA_MARKER0 | CA_MARKER1 | CA_MARKER2 | CA_MARKER3 | CA_MARKER4 | CA_MARKER5 | CA_MARKER6 | CA_MARKER7 | CA_MARKER8 | CA_MARKER9)
3535 
3536 #define CA_GBL_BUILD 0x00800000
3537 #define CA_GBL_INTERP 0x01000000
3538 #define CA_DISABLED 0x02000000
3539 #define CA_STATIC 0x04000000
3540 #define CA_NO_DECOMP 0x08000000
3542 #define CA_LOCATION 0x10000000
3543 #define CA_CONTENTS 0x20000000
3544 #define CA_PLAYER 0x40000000
3545 #define CF_DARK 0x80000000
3547 #define SW_MULTIPLE 0x80000000
3548 #define SW_GOT_UNIQUE 0x40000000
3549 #define SW_NOEVAL 0x20000000
3551 #define LIST_ATTRIBUTES 1
3552 #define LIST_COMMANDS 2
3553 #define LIST_COSTS 3
3554 #define LIST_FLAGS 4
3555 #define LIST_FUNCTIONS 5
3556 #define LIST_GLOBALS 6

3596  cache_sync(); \

3598  }

3600 #define OPTIMIZE (void)dddb_optimize()
3601 
3606 #define ATRNUM_BLOCK_SIZE (int)((mudstate.db_block_size - 32) / (2 * sizeof(int) + VNAME_SIZE))
3607 #define ATRNUM_BLOCK_BYTES (int)((ATRNUM_BLOCK_SIZE) * (2 * sizeof(int) + VNAME_SIZE))
3608 #define OBJECT_BLOCK_SIZE (int)((mudstate.db_block_size - 32) / (sizeof(int) + sizeof(DUMPOBJ)))
3609 #define OBJECT_BLOCK_BYTES (int)((OBJECT_BLOCK_SIZE) * (sizeof(int) + sizeof(DUMPOBJ)))
3610 #define ENTRY_NUM_BLOCKS(total, blksize) (int)(total / blksize)
3611 #define ENTRY_BLOCK_STARTS(blk, blksize) (int)(blk * blksize)
3612 #define ENTRY_BLOCK_ENDS(blk, blksize) (int)(blk * blksize) + (blksize - 1)
3613 
3614 #define ITER_PARENTS(t, p, l) for ((l) = 0, (p) = (t); \
3615  (Good_obj(p) && \
3616  ((l) < mudconf.parent_nest_lim)); \
3617  (p) = Parent(p), (l)++)
3618 
3619 #define Hasprivs(x) (Royalty(x) || Wizard(x))

3621 typedef char boolexp_type;
3622 
3623 typedef struct attr ATTR;
3624 struct attr
3625 {
3626  const char *name;
3627  int number;
3628  int flags;
3629  int (*check)(int, dbref, dbref, int, char *);
3630 };
3631

3636 #define anum_get(x) (anum_table[(x)])
3637 #define anum_set(x, v) anum_table[(x)] = v

3643 #define ATR_INFO_CHAR '\1'

3649 #define BOOLEXP_AND 0
3650 #define BOOLEXP_OR 1
3651 #define BOOLEXP_NOT 2

3675 #define F_UNKNOWN 0

3677 #define F_MUSE 2
3678 #define F_MUD 3
3679 #define F_MUCK 4
3680 #define F_MUX 5
3681 #define F_TINYMUSH 6
3683 #define V_MASK 0x000000ff
3684 #define V_ZONE 0x00000100
3685 #define V_LINK 0x00000200
3686 #define V_GDBM 0x00000400
3687 #define V_ATRNAME 0x00000800
3688 #define V_ATRKEY 0x00001000
3689 #define V_PERNKEY 0x00001000
3690 #define V_PARENT 0x00002000
3691 #define V_COMM 0x00004000
3692 #define V_ATRMONEY 0x00008000
3693 #define V_XFLAGS 0x00010000
3694 #define V_POWERS 0x00020000
3695 #define V_3FLAGS 0x00040000
3696 #define V_QUOTED 0x00080000

3699 #define V_VISUALATTRS 0x00400000
3700 #define V_CREATETIME 0x00800000
3701 #define V_DBCLEAN 0x80000000
3703 /* special dbref's */
3704 #define NOTHING (-1)
3705 #define AMBIGUOUS (-2)
3706 #define HOME (-3)
3707 #define NOPERM (-4)
3709 typedef struct object OBJ;
3710 struct object
3711 {
3712  dbref location;
3715  dbref contents;
3717  dbref exits;
3719  dbref next;
3722  dbref link;
3724  dbref parent;
3725  dbref owner;
3727  dbref zone;
3728  FLAG flags;
3729  FLAG flags2;
3730  FLAG flags3;
3731  POWER powers;
3732  POWER powers2;
3733  time_t create_time;
3734  time_t last_access;
3735  time_t last_mod;
3741  int name_length;
3742  int stack_count;
3743  int vars_count;
3744  int struct_count;
3745  int instance_count;
3746  struct timeval cpu_time_used;
3747 #ifdef MEMORY_BASED
3748  Obj attrtext;
3749 #endif
3750 };
3751 
3757 typedef struct dump_object DUMPOBJ;
3758 struct dump_object
3759 {
3760  dbref location;
3763  dbref contents;
3765  dbref exits;
3767  dbref next;
3770  dbref link;
3772  dbref parent;
3773  dbref owner;
3775  dbref zone;
3776  FLAG flags;
3777  FLAG flags2;
3778  FLAG flags3;
3779  POWER powers;
3780  POWER powers2;
3781  time_t create_time;
3782  time_t last_access;
3783  time_t last_mod;
3784 };
3785 
3786 typedef char *NAME;
3787 extern OBJ *db;
3788 extern NAME *names;
3789 extern NAME *purenames;
3790 extern int anum_alc_top;
3792 #define Location(t) db[t].location
3793 
3794 #define Zone(t) db[t].zone
3795 
3796 #define Contents(t) db[t].contents
3797 #define Exits(t) db[t].exits
3798 #define Next(t) db[t].next
3799 #define Link(t) db[t].link
3800 #define Owner(t) db[t].owner
3801 #define Parent(t) db[t].parent
3802 #define Flags(t) db[t].flags
3803 #define Flags2(t) db[t].flags2
3804 #define Flags3(t) db[t].flags3
3805 #define Powers(t) db[t].powers
3806 #define Powers2(t) db[t].powers2
3807 #define NameLen(t) db[t].name_length
3808 #define Home(t) Link(t)
3809 #define Dropto(t) Location(t)
3810 
3811 #define AccessTime(t) db[t].last_access
3812 #define ModTime(t) db[t].last_mod
3813 #define CreateTime(t) db[t].create_time
3814 
3815 #define VarsCount(t) db[t].vars_count
3816 #define StackCount(t) db[t].stack_count
3817 #define StructCount(t) db[t].struct_count
3818 #define InstanceCount(t) db[t].instance_count
3819 
3820 #define Time_Used(t) db[t].cpu_time_used
3821 #define s_Time_Used(t, n) \
3822  db[t].cpu_time_used.tv_sec = n.tv_sec; \
3823  db[t].cpu_time_used.tv_usec = n.tv_usec
3824 
3831 #define s_Location(t, n) \
3832  db[t].location = (n); \
3833  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3834 #define s_Zone(t, n) \
3835  db[t].zone = (n); \
3836  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3837 #define s_Contents(t, n) \
3838  db[t].contents = (n); \
3839  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3840 #define s_Exits(t, n) \
3841  db[t].exits = (n); \
3842  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3843 #define s_Next(t, n) \
3844  db[t].next = (n); \
3845  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3846 #define s_Link(t, n) \
3847  db[t].link = (n); \
3848  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3849 #define s_Owner(t, n) \
3850  db[t].owner = (n); \
3851  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3852 #define s_Parent(t, n) \
3853  db[t].parent = (n); \
3854  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3855 #define s_Flags(t, n) \
3856  db[t].flags = (n); \
3857  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3858 #define s_Flags2(t, n) \
3859  db[t].flags2 = (n); \
3860  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3861 #define s_Flags3(t, n) \
3862  db[t].flags3 = (n); \
3863  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3864 #define s_Powers(t, n) \
3865  db[t].powers = (n); \
3866  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3867 #define s_Powers2(t, n) \
3868  db[t].powers2 = (n); \
3869  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3870 #define s_AccessTime(t, n) \
3871  db[t].last_access = (n); \
3872  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3873 #define s_ModTime(t, n) \
3874  db[t].last_mod = (n); \
3875  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3876 #define s_CreateTime(t, n) \
3877  db[t].create_time = (n); \
3878  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3879 #define s_Accessed(t) \
3880  db[t].last_access = mudstate.now; \
3881  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3882 #define s_Modified(t) \
3883  db[t].last_mod = mudstate.now; \
3884  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3885 #define s_Created(t) \
3886  db[t].create_time = mudstate.now; \
3887  db[t].flags3 |= DIRTY
3888 #define s_Clean(t) db[t].flags3 = db[t].flags3 & ~DIRTY
3889 #define s_NameLen(t, n) db[t].name_length = (n)
3890 #define s_Home(t, n) s_Link(t, n)
3891 #define s_Dropto(t, n) s_Location(t, n)
3892 #define s_VarsCount(t, n) db[t].vars_count = n;
3893 #define s_StackCount(t, n) db[t].stack_count = n;
3894 #define s_StructCount(t, n) db[t].struct_count = n;
3895 #define s_InstanceCount(t, n) db[t].instance_count = n;
3896 
3897 #define tf_pclose(f) tf_fclose(f)
3898 
3899 #define putref(pr__f, pr__ref) fprintf(pr__f, "%d\n", (int)pr__ref)
3900 #define putlong(pr__f, pr__i) fprintf(pr__f, "%ld\n", (long)pr__i)
3901 
3902 #define DOLIST(thing, list) \
3903  for ((thing) = (list); \
3904  ((thing) != NOTHING) && (Next(thing) != (thing)); \
3905  (thing) = Next(thing))
3906 #define SAFE_DOLIST(thing, next, list) \
3907  for ((thing) = (list), (next) = ((thing) == NOTHING ? NOTHING : Next(thing)); \
3908  (thing) != NOTHING && (Next(thing) != (thing)); \
3909  (thing) = (next), (next) = Next(next))
3910 #define DO_WHOLE_DB(thing) \
3911  for ((thing) = 0; (thing) < mudstate.db_top; (thing)++)
3912 #define DO_WHOLE_DB_BACKWARDS(thing) \
3913  for ((thing) = mudstate.db_top - 1; (thing) >= 0; (thing)--)
3914 
3915 #define Dropper(thing) (Connected(Owner(thing)) && Hearer(thing))
3916 
3921 #define Clear_Player_Aliases(x, b) \
3922  { \
3923  char *cpa__p, *cpa__tokp; \
3924  for (cpa__p = strtok_r((b), ";", &cpa__tokp); cpa__p; \
3925  cpa__p = strtok_r(NULL, ";", &cpa__tokp)) \
3926  { \
3927  delete_player_name((x), cpa__p); \
3928  } \
3929  }
3930 
3931 typedef struct logfiletable LOGFILETAB;

3933 {
3934  int log_flag;
3935  FILE *fileptr;
3936  char *filename;
3937 };

3942  int num;

3944 
3945 #endif /* __DB_H */

3947 
3948 /*
3949  * From api.h
3950  */
3951 
3952 #ifndef __API_H
3953 #define __API_H
3954 
3955 #define SIZE_HACK 1
3956 
3961 #define DB_GROW_MODULE(old_db, new_size, new_top, proto) \
3962  { \
3963  char *dg__cp; \
3964  proto *dg__new_db; \
3965  int dg__i; \
3966  dg__new_db = (proto *)XMALLOC((new_size + SIZE_HACK) * sizeof(proto), "db_grow.mod_db"); \
3967  if (!dg__new_db) \
3968  { \
3969  log_write(LOG_ALWAYS, "ALC", "DB", "Could not allocate space for %d item module struct database.", new_size); \
3970  abort(); \
3971  } \
3972  if (old_db) \
3973  { \
3974  old_db -= SIZE_HACK; \
3975  memcpy((char *)dg__new_db, (char *)old_db, \
3976  (mudstate.db_top + SIZE_HACK) * sizeof(proto)); \
3977  dg__cp = (char *)old_db; \
3978  XFREE(dg__cp); \
3979  } \
3980  else \
3981  { \
3982  old_db = dg__new_db; \
3983  for (dg__i = 0; dg__i < SIZE_HACK; dg__i++) \
3984  { /* 'NOTHING' fill */ \
3985  OBJ_INIT_MODULE(dg__i); /* define macro in module file */ \
3986  } \
3987  } \
3988  old_db = dg__new_db + SIZE_HACK; \
3989  for (dg__i = mudstate.db_top; dg__i < new_size; dg__i++) \
3990  { \
3991  OBJ_INIT_MODULE(dg__i); \
3992  } \
3993  }
3994 
3995 #endif /* __API_H */
3996

4001 
4002 #ifndef __INTERFACE_H
4003 #define __INTERFACE_H
4004 
4005 /* (Dis)connection reason codes */
4006 
4007 #define R_GUEST 1 /* Guest connection */
4008 #define R_CREATE 2 /* User typed 'create' */
4009 #define R_CONNECT 3 /* User typed 'connect' */
4010 #define R_DARK 4 /* User typed 'cd' */
4011 
4012 #define R_QUIT 5 /* User quit */
4013 #define R_TIMEOUT 6 /* Inactivity timeout */
4014 #define R_BOOT 7 /* Victim of @boot, @toad, or @destroy */
4015 #define R_SOCKDIED 8 /* Other end of socket closed it */
4016 #define R_GOING_DOWN 9 /* Game is going down */
4017 #define R_BADLOGIN 10 /* Too many failed login attempts */
4018 #define R_GAMEDOWN 11 /* Not admitting users now */
4019 #define R_LOGOUT 12 /* Logged out w/o disconnecting */
4020 #define R_GAMEFULL 13 /* Too many players logged in */
4021 
4022 /* Logged out command table definitions */
4023 
4024 #define CMD_QUIT 1
4025 #define CMD_WHO 2
4026 #define CMD_DOING 3
4027 #define CMD_PREFIX 5
4028 #define CMD_SUFFIX 6
4029 #define CMD_LOGOUT 7
4030 #define CMD_SESSION 8
4031 #define CMD_PUEBLOCLIENT 9
4032 #define CMD_INFO 10
4033 
4034 #define CMD_MASK 0xff
4035 #define CMD_NOxFIX 0x100
4036 
4037 typedef struct cmd_block CBLK;
4038 typedef struct cmd_block_hdr CBLKHDR;
4039 struct cmd_block_hdr
4040 {
4041  struct cmd_block *nxt;
4042 };
4043 struct cmd_block
4044 {
4045  CBLKHDR hdr;
4046  char cmd[LBUF_SIZE - sizeof(CBLKHDR)];
4047 };
4048 
4049 typedef struct text_block TBLOCK;
4050 typedef struct text_block_hdr TBLKHDR;
4051 
4052 struct text_block_hdr
4053 {
4054  struct text_block *nxt;
4055  char *start;
4056  char *end;
4057  int nchars;
4058 };
4059 
4060 struct text_block
4061 {
4062  TBLKHDR hdr;
4063  char *data;
4064 };
4065 
4066 typedef struct prog_data PROG;

4071 };
4072 
4073 typedef struct descriptor_data DESC;
4074 struct descriptor_data
4075 {
4076  int descriptor;
4077  int flags;
4078  int retries_left;
4079  int command_count;
4080  int timeout;
4081  int host_info;
4082  char addr[51];
4083  char username[11];
4084  char *doing;
4085  dbref player;
4086  int *colormap;
4087  char *output_prefix;
4088  char *output_suffix;
4089  int output_size;
4090  int output_tot;
4091  int output_lost;
4092  TBLOCK *output_head;
4093  TBLOCK *output_tail;
4094  int input_size;
4095  int input_tot;
4096  int input_lost;
4097  CBLK *input_head;
4098  CBLK *input_tail;
4099  CBLK *raw_input;
4100  char *raw_input_at;
4101  time_t connected_at;
4102  time_t last_time;
4103  int quota;
4104  PROG *program_data;
4105  struct sockaddr_in address; /* added 3/6/90 SCG */
4106  struct descriptor_data *hashnext;
4107  struct descriptor_data *next;
4108  struct descriptor_data **prev;
4109 };
4110 
4111 /* flags in the flag field */
4112 #define DS_CONNECTED 0x0001 /* player is connected */
4113 #define DS_AUTODARK 0x0002 /* Wizard was auto set dark. */
4114 #define DS_PUEBLOCLIENT 0x0004 /* Client is Pueblo-enhanced. */
4115 
4116 extern DESC *descriptor_list;
4117 
4118 #ifndef HAVE_GETTIMEOFDAY
4119 #define get_tod(x) \
4120  { \
4121  (x)->tv_sec = time(NULL); \
4122  (x)->tv_usec = 0; \
4123  }
4124 #else
4125 #define get_tod(x) gettimeofday(x, NULL)
4126 #endif
4127 
4128 /* From predicates.c */
4129 
4130 #define DESC_ITER_PLAYER(p, d) \
4131  for (d = (DESC *)nhashfind((int)p, &mudstate.desc_htab); d; d = d->hashnext)
4132 #define DESC_ITER_CONN(d) \
4133  for (d = descriptor_list; (d); d = (d)->next) \
4134  if ((d)->flags & DS_CONNECTED)
4135 #define DESC_ITER_ALL(d) \
4136  for (d = descriptor_list; (d); d = (d)->next)
4137 
4138 #define DESC_SAFEITER_PLAYER(p, d, n) \
4139  for (d = (DESC *)nhashfind((int)p, &mudstate.desc_htab), \
4140  n = ((d != NULL) ? d->hashnext : NULL); \
4141  d; \
4142  d = n, n = ((n != NULL) ? n->hashnext : NULL))
4143 #define DESC_SAFEITER_CONN(d, n) \
4144  for (d = descriptor_list, n = ((d != NULL) ? d->next : NULL); \
4145  d; \
4146  d = n, n = ((n != NULL) ? n->next : NULL)) \
4147  if ((d)->flags & DS_CONNECTED)
4148 #define DESC_SAFEITER_ALL(d, n) \
4149  for (d = descriptor_list, n = ((d != NULL) ? d->next : NULL); \
4150  d; \
4151  d = n, n = ((n != NULL) ? n->next : NULL))
4152

4185 /* Command handler keys */
4186 
4187 #define ADDCMD_PRESERVE 1 /* Use player rather than addcommand thing */
4188 #define ATTRIB_ACCESS 1 /* Change access to attribute */
4189 #define ATTRIB_RENAME 2 /* Rename attribute */
4190 #define ATTRIB_DELETE 4 /* Delete attribute */
4191 #define ATTRIB_INFO 8 /* Info (number, flags) about attribute */
4192 #define BOOT_QUIET 1 /* Inhibit boot message to victim */
4193 #define BOOT_PORT 2 /* Boot by port number */
4194 #define CHOWN_ONE 1 /* item = new_owner */
4195 #define CHOWN_ALL 2 /* old_owner = new_owner */
4196 #define CHOWN_NOSTRIP 4 /* Don't strip (most) flags from object */
4197 #define CHZONE_NOSTRIP 1 /* Don't strip (most) flags from object */
4198 #define CLONE_LOCATION 0 /* Create cloned object in my location */
4199 #define CLONE_INHERIT 1 /* Keep INHERIT bit if set */
4200 #define CLONE_PRESERVE 2 /* Preserve the owner of the object */
4201 #define CLONE_INVENTORY 4 /* Create cloned object in my inventory */
4202 #define CLONE_SET_COST 8 /* ARG2 is cost of cloned object */
4203 #define CLONE_FROM_PARENT 16 /* Set parent instead of cloning attrs */
4204 #define CLONE_NOSTRIP 32 /* Don't strip (most) flags from clone */
4205 #define DBCK_FULL 1 /* Do all tests */
4206 #define DECOMP_PRETTY 1 /* pretty-format output */
4207 #define DEST_ONE 1 /* object */
4208 #define DEST_ALL 2 /* owner */
4209 #define DEST_OVERRIDE 4 /* override Safe() */
4210 #define DEST_INSTANT 8 /* instantly destroy */
4211 #define DIG_TELEPORT 1 /* teleport to room after @digging */
4212 #define DOLIST_SPACE 0 /* expect spaces as delimiter */
4213 #define DOLIST_DELIMIT 1 /* expect custom delimiter */
4214 #define DOLIST_NOTIFY 2 /* queue a '@notify me' at the end */
4215 #define DOLIST_NOW 4 /* Run commands immediately, no queueing */
4216 #define DOING_MESSAGE 0 /* Set my DOING message */
4217 #define DOING_HEADER 1 /* Set the DOING header */
4218 #define DOING_POLL 2 /* List DOING header */
4219 #define DOING_QUIET 4 /* Inhibit 'Set.' message */
4220 #define DROP_QUIET 1 /* Don't do Odrop/Adrop if control */
4221 #define DUMP_STRUCT 1 /* Dump flat structure file */
4222 #define DUMP_TEXT 2 /* Dump text (gdbm) file */
4223 #define DUMP_FLATFILE 8 /* Dump to flatfile */
4224 #define DUMP_OPTIMIZE 16 /* Optimized dump */
4225 #define ENDCMD_BREAK 0 /* @break - end action list on true */
4226 #define ENDCMD_ASSERT 1 /* @assert - end action list on false */
4227 #define EXAM_DEFAULT 0 /* Default */
4228 #define EXAM_BRIEF 1 /* Don't show attributes */
4229 #define EXAM_LONG 2 /* Nonowner sees public attrs too */
4230 #define EXAM_DEBUG 4 /* Display more info for finding db problems */
4231 #define EXAM_PARENT 8 /* Get attr from parent when exam obj/attr */
4232 #define EXAM_PRETTY 16 /* Pretty-format output */
4233 #define EXAM_PAIRS 32 /* Print paren matches in color */
4234 #define EXAM_OWNER 64 /* Nonowner sees just owner */
4235 #define FIXDB_OWNER 1 /* Fix OWNER field */
4236 #define FIXDB_LOC 2 /* Fix LOCATION field */
4237 #define FIXDB_CON 4 /* Fix CONTENTS field */
4238 #define FIXDB_EXITS 8 /* Fix EXITS field */
4239 #define FIXDB_NEXT 16 /* Fix NEXT field */
4240 #define FIXDB_PENNIES 32 /* Fix PENNIES field */
4241 #define FIXDB_NAME 64 /* Set NAME attribute */
4242 #define FLOATERS_ALL 1 /* Display all floating rooms in db */
4243 #define FUNCT_LIST 1 /* List the user-defined functions */
4244 #define FUNCT_NO_EVAL 2 /* Don't evaluate args to function */
4245 #define FUNCT_PRIV 4 /* Perform ufun as holding obj */
4246 #define FUNCT_PRES 8 /* Preserve r-regs before ufun */
4247 #define FUNCT_NOREGS 16 /* Private r-regs for ufun */
4248 #define FRC_COMMAND 1 /* what=command */
4249 #define FRC_NOW 2 /* run command immediately, no queueing */
4250 #define GET_QUIET 1 /* Don't do osucc/asucc if control */
4251 #define GIVE_QUIET 1 /* Inhibit give messages */
4252 #define GLOB_ENABLE 1 /* key to enable */
4253 #define GLOB_DISABLE 2 /* key to disable */
4254 #define HALT_ALL 1 /* halt everything */
4255 #define HALT_PID 2 /* halt a particular PID */
4256 #define HELP_FIND 1 /* do a wildcard search through help subjects */
4257 #define HELP_RAWHELP 0x08000000 /* A high bit. Don't eval text. */
4258 #define HOOK_BEFORE 1 /* pre-command hook */
4259 #define HOOK_AFTER 2 /* post-command hook */
4260 #define HOOK_PRESERVE 4 /* preserve global regs */
4261 #define HOOK_NOPRESERVE 8 /* don't preserve global regs */
4262 #define HOOK_PERMIT 16 /* user-defined permissions */
4263 #define HOOK_PRIVATE 32 /* private global regs */
4264 #define KILL_KILL 1 /* gives victim insurance */
4265 #define KILL_SLAY 2 /* no insurance */
4266 #define LOOK_LOOK 1 /* list desc (and succ/fail if room) */
4267 #define LOOK_INVENTORY 2 /* list inventory of object */
4268 #define LOOK_SCORE 4 /* list score (# coins) */
4269 #define LOOK_OUTSIDE 8 /* look for object in container of player */
4270 #define MARK_SET 0 /* Set mark bits */
4271 #define MARK_CLEAR 1 /* Clear mark bits */
4272 #define MOTD_ALL 0 /* login message for all */
4273 #define MOTD_WIZ 1 /* login message for wizards */
4274 #define MOTD_DOWN 2 /* login message when logins disabled */
4275 #define MOTD_FULL 4 /* login message when too many players on */
4276 #define MOTD_LIST 8 /* Display current login messages */
4277 #define MOTD_BRIEF 16 /* Suppress motd file display for wizards */
4278 #define MOVE_QUIET 1 /* Dont do Osucc/Ofail/Asucc/Afail if ctrl */
4279 #define NFY_NFY 0 /* Notify first waiting command */
4280 #define NFY_NFYALL 1 /* Notify all waiting commands */
4281 #define NFY_DRAIN 2 /* Delete waiting commands */
4282 #define NREF_LIST 1 /* List rather than set nrefs */
4283 #define OPEN_LOCATION 0 /* Open exit in my location */
4284 #define OPEN_INVENTORY 1 /* Open exit in me */
4285 #define PASS_ANY 1 /* name=newpass */
4286 #define PASS_MINE 2 /* oldpass=newpass */
4287 #define PCRE_PLAYER 1 /* create new player */
4288 #define PCRE_ROBOT 2 /* create robot player */
4289 #define PEMIT_PEMIT 1 /* emit to named player */
4290 #define PEMIT_OEMIT 2 /* emit to all in current room except named */
4291 #define PEMIT_WHISPER 3 /* whisper to player in current room */
4292 #define PEMIT_FSAY 4 /* force controlled obj to say */
4293 #define PEMIT_FEMIT 5 /* force controlled obj to emit */
4294 #define PEMIT_FPOSE 6 /* force controlled obj to pose */
4295 #define PEMIT_FPOSE_NS 7 /* force controlled obj to pose w/o space */
4296 #define PEMIT_CONTENTS 8 /* Send to contents (additive) */
4297 #define PEMIT_HERE 16 /* Send to location (@femit, additive) */
4298 #define PEMIT_ROOM 32 /* Send to containing rm (@femit, additive) */
4299 #define PEMIT_LIST 64 /* Send to a list */
4300 #define PEMIT_SPEECH 128 /* Explicitly tag this as speech */
4301 #define PEMIT_HTML 256 /* HTML escape, and no newline */
4302 #define PEMIT_MOVE 512 /* Explicitly tag this as a movement message */
4303 #define PEMIT_SPOOF 1024 /* change enactor to target object */
4304 #define PS_BRIEF 0 /* Short PS report */
4305 #define PS_LONG 1 /* Long PS report */
4306 #define PS_SUMM 2 /* Queue counts only */
4307 #define PS_ALL 4 /* List entire queue */
4308 #define QUEUE_KICK 1 /* Process commands from queue */
4309 #define QUEUE_WARP 2 /* Advance or set back wait queue clock */
4310 #define QUOTA_SET 1 /* Set a quota */
4311 #define QUOTA_FIX 2 /* Repair a quota */
4312 #define QUOTA_TOT 4 /* Operate on total quota */
4313 #define QUOTA_REM 8 /* Operate on remaining quota */
4314 #define QUOTA_ALL 16 /* Operate on all players */
4315 #define QUOTA_ROOM 32 /* Room quota set */
4316 #define QUOTA_EXIT 64 /* Exit quota set */
4317 #define QUOTA_THING 128 /* Thing quota set */
4318 #define QUOTA_PLAYER 256 /* Player quota set */
4319 #define SAY_SAY 1 /* say in current room */
4320 #define SAY_NOSPACE 1 /* OR with xx_EMIT to get nospace form */
4321 #define SAY_POSE 2 /* pose in current room */
4322 #define SAY_POSE_NOSPC 3 /* pose w/o space in current room */
4323 #define SAY_EMIT 5 /* emit in current room */
4324 #define SAY_SHOUT 8 /* shout to all logged-in players */
4325 #define SAY_WALLPOSE 9 /* Pose to all logged-in players */
4326 #define SAY_WALLEMIT 10 /* Emit to all logged-in players */
4327 #define SAY_WIZSHOUT 12 /* shout to all logged-in wizards */
4328 #define SAY_WIZPOSE 13 /* Pose to all logged-in wizards */
4329 #define SAY_WIZEMIT 14 /* Emit to all logged-in wizards */
4330 #define SAY_ADMINSHOUT 15 /* Emit to all wizards or royalty */
4331 #define SAY_NOTAG 32 /* Don't put Broadcast: in front (additive) */
4332 #define SAY_HERE 64 /* Output to current location */
4333 #define SAY_ROOM 128 /* Output to containing room */
4334 #define SAY_HTML 256 /* Don't output a newline */
4335 #define SAY_PREFIX 512 /* first char indicates formatting */
4336 #define SET_QUIET 1 /* Don't display 'Set.' message. */
4337 #define SHUTDN_COREDUMP 1 /* Produce a coredump */
4338 #define SRCH_SEARCH 1 /* Do a normal search */
4339 #define SRCH_MARK 2 /* Set mark bit for matches */
4340 #define SRCH_UNMARK 3 /* Clear mark bit for matches */
4341 #define STAT_PLAYER 0 /* Display stats for one player or tot objs */
4342 #define STAT_ALL 1 /* Display global stats */
4343 #define STAT_ME 2 /* Display stats for me */
4344 #define SWITCH_DEFAULT 0 /* Use the configured default for switch */
4345 #define SWITCH_ANY 1 /* Execute all cases that match */
4346 #define SWITCH_ONE 2 /* Execute only first case that matches */
4347 #define SWITCH_NOW 4 /* Execute case(s) immediately, no queueing */
4348 #define SWEEP_ME 1 /* Check my inventory */
4349 #define SWEEP_HERE 2 /* Check my location */
4350 #define SWEEP_COMMANDS 4 /* Check for $-commands */
4351 #define SWEEP_LISTEN 8 /* Check for @listen-ers */
4352 #define SWEEP_PLAYER 16 /* Check for players and puppets */
4353 #define SWEEP_CONNECT 32 /* Search for connected players/puppets */
4354 #define SWEEP_EXITS 64 /* Search the exits for audible flags */
4355 #define SWEEP_VERBOSE 256 /* Display what pattern matches */
4356 #define TELEPORT_DEFAULT 1 /* Emit all messages */
4357 #define TELEPORT_QUIET 2 /* Teleport in quietly */
4358 #define TIMECHK_RESET 1 /* Reset all counters to zero */
4359 #define TIMECHK_SCREEN 2 /* Write info to screen */
4360 #define TIMECHK_LOG 4 /* Write info to log */
4361 #define TOAD_NO_CHOWN 1 /* Don't change ownership */
4362 #define TRIG_QUIET 1 /* Don't display 'Triggered.' message. */
4363 #define TRIG_NOW 2 /* Run immediately, no queueing */
4364 #define TWARP_QUEUE 1 /* Warp the wait and sem queues */
4365 #define TWARP_DUMP 2 /* Warp the dump interval */
4366 #define TWARP_CLEAN 4 /* Warp the cleaning interval */
4367 #define TWARP_IDLE 8 /* Warp the idle check interval */
4368 /* twarp empty 16 */
4369 #define TWARP_EVENTS 32 /* Warp the events checking interval */
4370 #define VERB_NOW 1 /* Run @afoo immediately, no queueing */
4371 #define VERB_MOVE 2 /* Treat like movement message */
4372 #define VERB_SPEECH 4 /* Treat like speech message */
4373 #define VERB_PRESENT 8 /* Treat like presence message */
4374 #define VERB_NONAME 16 /* Do not prepend name to odefault */
4375 #define WAIT_UNTIL 1 /* Absolute time wait */
4376 #define WAIT_PID 2 /* Change the wait on a PID */
4377 
4378 /* Hush codes for movement messages */
4379 
4380 #define HUSH_ENTER 1 /* xENTER/xEFAIL */
4381 #define HUSH_LEAVE 2 /* xLEAVE/xLFAIL */
4382 #define HUSH_EXIT 4 /* xSUCC/xDROP/xFAIL from exits */
4383 
4384 /* Evaluation directives */
4385 
4386 #define EV_FIGNORE 0x00000000 /* Don't look for func if () found */
4387 #define EV_FMAND 0x00000100 /* Text before () must be func name */
4388 #define EV_FCHECK 0x00000200 /* Check text before () for function */
4389 #define EV_STRIP 0x00000400 /* Strip one level of brackets */
4390 #define EV_EVAL 0x00000800 /* Evaluate results before returning */
4391 #define EV_STRIP_TS 0x00001000 /* Strip trailing spaces */
4392 #define EV_STRIP_LS 0x00002000 /* Strip leading spaces */
4393 #define EV_STRIP_ESC 0x00004000 /* Strip one level of \ characters */
4394 #define EV_STRIP_AROUND 0x00008000 /* Strip {} only at ends of string */
4395 #define EV_TOP 0x00010000 /* This is a toplevel call to eval() */
4396 #define EV_NOTRACE 0x00020000 /* Don't trace this call to eval */
4397 #define EV_NO_COMPRESS 0x00040000 /* Don't compress spaces. */
4398 #define EV_NO_LOCATION 0x00080000 /* Suppresses %l */
4399 #define EV_NOFCHECK 0x00100000 /* Do not evaluate functions! */
4400 
4401 /* Function flags */
4402 
4403 #define FN_VARARGS 0x80000000 /* allows variable # of args */
4404 #define FN_NO_EVAL 0x40000000 /* Don't evaluate args to function */
4405 #define FN_PRIV 0x20000000 /* Perform ufun as holding obj */
4406 #define FN_PRES 0x10000000 /* Preserve r-regs before ufun */
4407 #define FN_NOREGS 0x08000000 /* Private r-regs for ufun */
4408 #define FN_DBFX 0x04000000 /* DB-affecting side effects */
4409 #define FN_QFX 0x02000000 /* Queue-affecting side effects */
4410 #define FN_OUTFX 0x01000000 /* Output-affecting side effects */
4411 #define FN_STACKFX 0x00800000 /* All stack functions */
4412 #define FN_VARFX 0x00400000 /* All xvars functions */
4413 
4414 /* Lower flag values are used for function-specific switches */
4415 
4416 /* Message forwarding directives */
4417 
4418 #define MSG_PUP_ALWAYS 0x00001 /* Always forward msg to puppet own */
4419 #define MSG_INV 0x00002 /* Forward msg to contents */
4420 #define MSG_INV_L 0x00004 /* ... only if msg passes my @listen */
4421 #define MSG_INV_EXITS 0x00008 /* Forward through my audible exits */
4422 #define MSG_NBR 0x00010 /* Forward msg to neighbors */
4423 #define MSG_NBR_A 0x00020 /* ... only if I am audible */
4424 #define MSG_NBR_EXITS 0x00040 /* Also forward to neighbor exits */
4425 #define MSG_NBR_EXITS_A 0x00080 /* ... only if I am audible */
4426 #define MSG_LOC 0x00100 /* Send to my location */
4427 #define MSG_LOC_A 0x00200 /* ... only if I am audible */
4428 #define MSG_FWDLIST 0x00400 /* Forward to my fwdlist members if audible */
4429 #define MSG_ME 0x00800 /* Send to me */
4430 #define MSG_S_INSIDE 0x01000 /* Originator is inside target */
4431 #define MSG_S_OUTSIDE 0x02000 /* Originator is outside target */
4432 #define MSG_HTML 0x04000 /* Don't send \r\n */
4433 #define MSG_SPEECH 0x08000 /* This message is speech. */
4434 #define MSG_MOVE 0x10000 /* This message is movement. */
4435 #define MSG_PRESENCE 0x20000 /* This message is related to presence. */
4436 #define MSG_ME_ALL (MSG_ME | MSG_INV_EXITS | MSG_FWDLIST)
4437 #define MSG_F_CONTENTS (MSG_INV)
4438 #define MSG_F_UP (MSG_NBR_A | MSG_LOC_A)
4439 #define MSG_F_DOWN (MSG_INV_L)
4440 
4441 /* Look primitive directives */
4442 
4443 #define LK_IDESC 0x0001
4444 #define LK_OBEYTERSE 0x0002
4445 #define LK_SHOWATTR 0x0004
4446 #define LK_SHOWEXIT 0x0008
4447 #define LK_SHOWVRML 0x0010
4448 
4449 /* Quota types */
4450 #define QTYPE_ALL 0
4451 #define QTYPE_ROOM 1
4452 #define QTYPE_EXIT 2
4453 #define QTYPE_THING 3
4454 #define QTYPE_PLAYER 4
4455 
4456 /* Signal handling directives */
4457 
4458 #define SA_EXIT 1 /* Exit, and dump core */
4459 #define SA_DFLT 2 /* Try to restart on a fatal error */
4460 
4461 /* Database dumping directives for dump_database_internal() */
4462 
4463 #define DUMP_DB_NORMAL 0
4464 #define DUMP_DB_CRASH 1
4465 #define DUMP_DB_RESTART 2
4466 #define DUMP_DB_FLATFILE 3
4467 #define DUMP_DB_KILLED 4
4468 
4469 /*
4470  * --------------------------------------------------------------------------
4471  * A zillion ways to notify things.
4472  */
4473 
4474 #define notify(p,m,...) notify_check(p, p, MSG_PUP_ALWAYS | MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_F_DOWN, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4475 #define notify_html(p,m,...) notify_check(p, p, MSG_PUP_ALWAYS | MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_F_DOWN | MSG_HTML, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4476 #define notify_quiet(p,m,...) notify_check(p, p, MSG_PUP_ALWAYS | MSG_ME, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4477 #define notify_with_cause(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_PUP_ALWAYS | MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_F_DOWN, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4478 #define notify_with_cause_html(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_PUP_ALWAYS | MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_F_DOWN | MSG_HTML, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4479 #define notify_with_cause_extra(p,c,m,f,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_PUP_ALWAYS | MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_F_DOWN | (f), NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4480 #define notify_quiet_with_cause(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_PUP_ALWAYS | MSG_ME, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4481 #define notify_puppet(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_F_DOWN, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4482 #define notify_quiet_puppet(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_ME, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4483 #define notify_all(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_NBR_EXITS | MSG_F_UP | MSG_F_CONTENTS, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4484 #define notify_all_from_inside(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_NBR_EXITS_A | MSG_F_UP | MSG_F_CONTENTS | MSG_S_INSIDE, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4485 #define notify_all_from_inside_speech(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_NBR_EXITS_A | MSG_F_UP | MSG_F_CONTENTS | MSG_S_INSIDE | MSG_SPEECH, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4486 #define notify_all_from_inside_move(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_NBR_EXITS_A | MSG_F_UP | MSG_F_CONTENTS | MSG_S_INSIDE | MSG_MOVE, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4487 #define notify_all_from_inside_html(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_NBR_EXITS_A | MSG_F_UP | MSG_F_CONTENTS | MSG_S_INSIDE | MSG_HTML, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4488 #define notify_all_from_inside_html_speech(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_NBR_EXITS_A | MSG_F_UP | MSG_F_CONTENTS | MSG_S_INSIDE | MSG_HTML | MSG_SPEECH, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4489 #define notify_all_from_outside(p,c,m,...) notify_check(p, c, MSG_ME_ALL | MSG_NBR_EXITS | MSG_F_UP | MSG_F_CONTENTS | MSG_S_OUTSIDE, NULL, m, ##__VA_ARGS__)
4490 
4491 #define CANNOT_HEAR_MSG "That target cannot hear you."
4492 #define NOT_PRESENT_MSG "That target is not present."
